guttmacher.org.notes: Is a leading research and policy organization committed to advancing sexual and reproductive health and rights in the United States.  Left of Center politically, but excellent sourcing and factual information.

adn.com.name: Alaska Dispatch News
adn.com.notes: The Alaska Dispatch News is a daily newspaper published by the Alaska Dispatch, and based in Anchorage, Alaska. The newspaper has won the Pulitzer Prize twice in the “Public Service” category, in 1976 and 1989. The Alaska Dispatch News is factual in reporting and has a left-center editorial bias.

timesunion.com.name: Albany Times-Union
timesunion.com.notes: The Albany Times Union is an American daily newspaper, serving the Capital Region of New York, United States. Although the newspaper focuses on Albany and its suburbs, it covers all parts of the four-county area, including the cities of Troy, Schenectady and Saratoga Springs.

ohio.com.name: Akron Beacon Journal
ohio.com.notes: The Akron Beacon Journal is a morning newspaper in Akron, Ohio, United States, and published by Black Press. It is the sole daily newspaper in Akron and is distributed throughout Northeast Ohio. The paper places a strong emphasis on local news and business.

amny.com.name: AM New York
amny.com.notes: AM New York is a morning free daily newspaper that is published in New York City by Newsday. AM New York has a left center reporting bias, but is well sourced and factual in reporting.

americamagazine.org.name: America Magazine
americamagazine.org.notes: America is a national weekly magazine published by the Jesuits of the United States and headquartered in midtown Manhattan. It contains news and opinion about Roman Catholicism and how it relates to American politics and cultural life. Published continuously since 1909, it is one of the oldest periodicals in the U.S. America is well sourced and factual. They use minimal loaded words in headlines and articles. While they do take somewhat conservative Catholic positions from an editorial standpoint, their reporting of news has a slight left center bias through favoring more liberal causes such as income equality and environmental protection. This is a reliable source. (D. Van Zandt)

aclu.org.name: American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU)
aclu.org.notes: The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) is a nonpartisan, non-profit, organization  whose stated mission is “to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties guaranteed to every person in this country by the Constitution and laws of the United States.” It works through litigation, lobbying, and community empowerment. The ACLU in their blog section and even news section often cite to places like the Huffington Post for news articles but sometimes they will use basic reporting like AP or Reuters. Beyond their news and blog posts most of the site covers issues that are often considered more liberal causes but most often it is consistent with their stance on the rights they champion. The ACLU has defended the KKK, Pro Abortion, and Neo-Nazi’s right to assemble and protest (1 2 3).  They will often be accused of being left biased as they do not advocate for gun rights, however they equally do not champion gun regulations either.  A quick search for Gun Rights or even Guns will yield no results or results only related to search and seizure cases they have taken on.  They do not agree on the individuals rights to own firearms but do not advocate on their beliefs.  They have teamed up with the NRA several times in a sort of odd fellowship (4). Their Blog & News feed’s can often be filled with more left leaning stances, but they are not biased in their case work load or defending the rights they advocate for. There have been times Justice Scalia the most outspoken and most conservative justice at the time had ideas that line up with the ACLU (5). Most modern conservatives may often take issue with much of what the ACLU advocates and litigates in courts. However, the ACLU has defended religious freedoms in the school as well. Including the right to pray in school (6). I would try to advocate that the ACLU is more neutral than left, but with the major shift in American politics to the right, I can no longer advocate that stance. (M. Allen)

ahtribune.com.name: American Herald Tribune
ahtribune.com.notes: The American Herald Tribune is an online independent news source.  The American Herald Tribune produces quality journalism that is factually based.  Has a left-center bias in content and reporting.

adl.org.name: Anti-Defamation League
adl.org.notes: The Anti-Defamation League is an international Jewish non-governmental organization based in the United States. Describing itself as “the nation’s premier civil rights/human relations agency,” the ADL states that it “fights anti-Semitism and all forms of bigotry, defends democratic ideals and protects civil rights for all,” doing so through “information, education, legislation, and advocacy.” Has been accused of having a liberal political bias.

aol.com.name: AOL
aol.com.notes: AOL is an online magazine featuring a variety of content, from politics to lifestyle to video games. While they don’t carry a lot of political content, what they do carry is factual, well sourced and delivered with minimal bias. Despite a very slight left slant it is still well within the Least Biased category. (D. Kelley)

aranews.net.name: Ara News
aranews.net.notes: ARA News is a Syrian independent press agency concerned with covering local developments across Syria, including its Kurdish region.

tucson.com.name: Arizona Daily Star
tucson.com.notes: The Arizona Daily Star is the major morning daily newspaper that serves Tucson and surrounding districts of southern Arizona in the United States.

citizen-times.com.name: Asheville Citizen-Times
citizen-times.com.notes: The Asheville Citizen-Times is a major daily newspaper from Asheville, North Carolina. Is well sourced with just a slight left of center bias in news coverage.

ajc.com.name: Atlanta Journal-Constitution
ajc.com.notes: The Atlanta Journal-Constitution (AJC) is the only major daily newspaper in the metropolitan area of Atlanta, Georgia, United States. The AJC is factual and sourced in reporting with a left of center editorial stance.

theatlantic.com.name: The Atlantic
theatlantic.com.notes: The Atlantic is an American magazine, founded in 1857 as The Atlantic Monthly in Boston, Massachusetts. Since 2006, the magazine is based in Washington, D.C. Created as a literary and cultural commentary magazine, it has grown to achieve a national reputation as a high-quality review organ with a moderate worldview. The periodical has won more National Magazine Awards than any other monthly magazine. Has a slightly liberal bias in reporting coverage, put produces exceptional journalism that is sourced and factual.

atlanticmedia.com.name: Atlantic Media
atlanticmedia.com.notes: Atlantic Media owns the following sources: www.govexec.com, www.nextgov.com, www.routefifty.com, qz.com, www.nationaljournal.com, www.theatlantic.com, www.citylab.com, www.defenseone.com. They borrow writers and share stories depending on the contact they are going with.  For example, an article on www.defenseone.com uses an article from www.nextgov.com  the writer is Joseph Marks – who covers cybersecurity for Nextgov. He previously covered cybersecurity for Politico. The sites all seem to have particular themes they focus on. Government, military, cyber, city, etc. Atlantic Media is the main company and keeps all these “brands” under that umbrella sharing writers and sources. Overall they are well sourced, truth filled, and lean slightly left. (M. Allen)

attn.com.name: ATTN:
attn.com.notes: ATTN is a political and social site geared towards millennials, although not exclusively so. Founded by Matthew Segal, a political activist and commentator who writes for the Huffington Post and is also a frequent commentator on MSNBC. While Mr. Segal’s politics are unashamedly left leaning,  the content of ATTN is factual and well sourced. The political tone of the articles is mixed, running from Left Bias to Least Biased. While this reflects the individual author’s opinions more than any specific editorial stance this slight lack of focus in overall content is what prevented ATTN from receiving a Least Biased rating. Additionally, ATTN does cite itself occasionally in its other articles, which I find a bit self serving when any news site does it. Even if the content cited is factual. While again, this may reflect the individual author’s rather than editorial intent, it’s easy enough to use external sources instead. That said, the quality of the content on the site is very high, and except for a slight caveat on the bias and self sourcing, I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend ATTN to anyone looking for a solid news source. (D. Kelley)

axios.com.name: Axios
axios.com.notes: AXIOS Media or Axios is a news and information company started in 2016 by Politico co-founder Jim VandeHei, former Chief White House correspondent at Politico, Mike Allen, and former Politico Chief Revenue Officer Roy Schwartz. Axios is well sourced and factual. Has a left-Center political bias in story selection.

backchannel.com.name: BackChannel
backchannel.com.notes: Back Channel (BC) is a technology reporting site that reports primarily on the internet and social media. The articles on the site are factual and well sourced. What political news BC carries is tech-centric as well, such as the article concerning Ajit Pai, President Trump’s pick to head the FCC. While the reporting on BC is solid there is, however, a slightly left bias in the overall tone. Much of that bias is inherent in the subject matter, but it doesn’t account for all of it. For this reason Back Channel is rated Left Center. (D. Kelley)

baltimoresun.com.name: Baltimore Sun
baltimoresun.com.notes: The Baltimore Sun is the largest general-circulation daily newspaper based in the American state of Maryland and provides coverage of local and regional news, events, issues, people, and industries. Founded in 1837, it is owned by Tronc, Inc. The Baltimore Sun is well sourced and factual with a left wing editorial bias.

baptistnews.com.name: Baptist News Global
baptistnews.com.notes: Baptist News Global is an independent Baptist news agency. It was founded in 2014 as a merger of Associated Baptist Press (ABP), which was founded in 1990, and the Religious Herald, which was founded in 1828.  Baptist News Global publishes curated news from many least biased, left-center and left wing sources.  They also publish their own news that has minimal bias.  Politically this source aligns in the left-center.  Information is well sourced and trustworthy.

bbc.com/news.name: BBC
bbc.com/news.notes: The British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) is a British public service broadcaster. It is headquartered at Broadcasting House in London, and is the world’s oldest national broadcasting organisation and the largest broadcaster in the world by number of employees. The BBC is an outstanding journalistic source.  They have just a slight left of center political bias in reporting coverage and they are always impeccably sourced.

bjreview.com.name: Beijing Review
bjreview.com.notes: Founded in March 1958 as the weekly Peking Review, it was an important tool for the People’s Republic of China government to communicate to the rest of world. Has a Communist, Maoist perspective, but reports new factually.

berkshireeagle.com.name: Berkshire Eagle
berkshireeagle.com.notes: The Berkshire Eagle is an American daily newspaper published in Pittsfield, Massachusetts, and covering all of Berkshire County, as well as four New York communities near Pittsfield. It is considered a newspaper of record for Berkshire County, Massachusetts. Factual with a Left-Center editorial bias.

billmoyers.com.name: BillMoyers.com
billmoyers.com.notes: Bill Moyers is a retired American news reporter and journalist. In 2012 Bill Moyers launched the website BillMoyers.com that combines a blog featuring essays and videos by managing editor Bill Moyers, as well as the perspectives of other journalists, scholars, activists, and creative men and women in the arts and sciences. The site also includes a video archive of Bill Moyers’s 40-plus year journalism career, offering nearly 1,000 archived programs, video clips and online-original segments (Billmoyers.com). Moyers has won countless journalism awards throughout his career and the content on his website is no exception to those standards. All articles are well sourced and factual. The content does have a left-center lean based on story selection and wording. (D. Van Zandt)

bloomberg.com.name: Bloomberg
bloomberg.com.notes: Bloomberg  is an American weekly business magazine published by Bloomberg L.P. The magazine was created to provide information and interpretation about what was happening in the business world. Primarily covers financial news, but does cover politics with a slight left wing bias in reporting. Usually factually sourced to credible information.

bluestemprairie.com.name: Bluestem Prairie
bluestemprairie.com.notes: Bluestem Prairie publishes articles and opinion by writers living in Greater Minnesota. Bias varies by writer ranging from left to low bias. Overall, the source presents with a left-center bias that favors progressive causes. They source well, but some do use loaded words to convey their message.

bostonglobe.com.name: Boston Globe
bostonglobe.com.notes: The Boston Globe is an American daily newspaper based in Boston, Massachusetts.  The Boston Globe has been awarded 23 Pulitzer Prizes since 1966. The Boston Globe is one of the largest newspapers in the USA.  Factual with a left of center editorial bias.

bgr.com.name: Boy Genius Report (BGR)
bgr.com.notes: Boy Genius Report (also referred to as BGR) is a technology-influenced website that covers topics ranging from consumer gadgets, to entertainment, gaming, and science. BGR also covers politics as it relates to technology with a left of center bias in reporting.

brookings.edu.name: Brookings Institute
brookings.edu.notes: The Brookings Institution is a century-old American research group. It conducts research and education in the social sciences, primarily in economics, metropolitan policy, governance, foreign policy, and global economy and development. Has a left of center political bias in reporting with factual sourced content.

buffalonews.com.name: Buffalo News
buffalonews.com.notes: The Buffalo News is the daily newspaper of the Buffalo – Niagara Falls metropolitan area. The paper is owned by Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway. Journalists for The Buffalo News and The Buffalo Evening News have won four Pulitzer Prizes. Factual news reporting with a left of center editorial bias.

businessinsider.com.name: Business Insider
businessinsider.com.notes: Business Insider is a German owned American news website that has a left of center bias in reporting.  Well sourced. Has been critcized for clickbait style.

bustle.com.name: Bustle Magazine
bustle.com.notes: Bustle is an online US women’s magazine founded in August 2013.  Bustle covers a variety of topics including political news that has a left of center bias based on story selection and a few loaded words.

buzzfeed.com/news.name: Buzzfeed
buzzfeed.com/news.notes: Buzzfeed is an internet media company that focuses on entertainment, but does have content for breaking news and politics. Buzzfeed occasionally uses loaded words with a left bias in headlines/articles and has failed some fact checks.

calgaryherald.com.name: Calgary Herald
calgaryherald.com.notes: The Calgary Herald is a Canadian daily newspaper published in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. Factual reporting, left of center editorial stance.

carolinapublicpress.org.name: Carolina Public Press
carolinapublicpress.org.notes: Carolina Public Press is North Carolina’s first online nonprofit news organization to be devoted to original, enterprise-level, in-depth and investigative journalism in the public interest. It’s also the only news organization in Western North Carolina to have credentialed journalists working in Raleigh as part of the Capitol Press Corps reporting on the N.C. General Assembly. Carolina Public Press has a left of center bias in reporting and political affiliation. Sources all information well.

cbc.ca/news.name: CBC News (Canadian Broadcasting)
cbc.ca/news.notes: CBC News is the division of the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation responsible for the news gathering and production of news programs on the corporation’s English-language operations, namely CBC Television, CBC Radio, CBC News Network, and CBC.ca. Founded in 1941, CBC News is the largest news broadcaster in Canada and has local, regional and national broadcasts and stations. Has been accused of liberal bias, but is sourced and factual in news reporting.

cbsnews.com.name: CBS News
cbsnews.com.notes: CBS News is a mainstream USA media source.  CBS News has a left-center bias in reporting and is usually well sourced and factual.

cctv-america.com.name: CCTV America
cctv-america.com.notes: CCTV America is the American division of CCTV News, the English-language news channel run by Chinese state broadcaster China Central Television. It is based in Washington, DC and manages bureaus across North and South America. The service employs a mix of American, international and Chinese journalists and produces Americas-based programming with a focus on Asia for CCTV News. Uses minimal loaded words, but is a Chinese state broadcaster and therefore has pro-China bias. Reports USA news straightforward and factually.

ciponline.org.name: Center for International Policy
ciponline.org.notes: The Center for International Policy (CIP) is a non-profit public policy research and advocacy think tank with offices in Washington, D.C. and New York City. It was founded in 1975 in response to the Vietnam War. The Center describes its mission as “promoting a U.S. foreign policy based on international cooperation, demilitarization and respect for human rights. Has a Left-Center bias in reporting and political affiliation.  Sources to factual information.

cbpp.org.name: The Center on Budget and Policy Priorities
cbpp.org.notes: The Center on Budget and Policy Priorities (CBPP) was founded by Robert Greenstein in 1981. CBPP advocates for state and federal economic policies with the goal of helping poor and low income Americans, and reducing income inequality. The articles on the site, while carrying an inherent left bias, are highly factual, well sourced, and carry a minimum of biased wording. CBPP states that they are nonpartisan, and carries through on that in their reporting. The inherent left bias in their goals and the economic policies they advocate for, however, earns them a left center rating. (D. Kelley)

wvgazettemail.com.name: Charleston Gazette-Mail
wvgazettemail.com.notes: The Charleston Gazette-Mail is the only daily morning newspaper in Charleston, West Virginia. It is the product of a July 2015 merger between the Charleston Gazette and the Charleston Daily Mail. Factual, sourced news reporting with a liberal editorial bias.

charlotteobserver.com.name: Charlotte Observer
charlotteobserver.com.notes: The Charlotte Observer is a newspaper serving Charlotte, North Carolina, and its metro area. It has the largest circulation in North Carolina and South Carolina. It is owned by The McClatchy Company. Reports news factually with a left-center editorial bias.

chicagoreporter.com.name: The Chicago Reporter
chicagoreporter.com.notes: The Chicago Reporter is a monthly periodical based in Chicago, Illinois, USA. Founded in 1972, it covers poverty and race issues with a left-center bias in reporting.

chicago.suntimes.com.name: Chicago Sun Times
chicago.suntimes.com.notes: The Chicago Sun-Times is a daily newspaper published in Chicago, Illinois. It is the flagship paper of the Sun-Times Media Group. Reports news with valid sources.  Has a left-center editorial stance.

chicagotribune.com.name: Chicago Tribune
chicagotribune.com.notes: The Chicago Tribune is a daily newspaper based in Chicago, Illinois, United States, owned by tronc, Inc. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

legitgov.org.name: Citizens for Legitimate Government (CLG News)
legitgov.org.notes: Citizens for Legitimate Government claim to be a multi-partisan activist group established to expose and resist US imperialism, corpora-terrorism, and the New World Order. They report a variety of political news and use pretty neutral language.  They do tend to veer slightly into conspiracies, but otherwise publishes short informative news.

ctj.org.name: Citizens for Tax Justice
ctj.org.notes: Citizens for Tax Justice is a progressive Washington, D.C.-based advocacy and lobbying think tank founded in 1979. CTJ’s work focuses primarily on federal tax policy.  CTJ is generally considered to be a left-wing organization, but its research has also been cited by Republican politicians and right-wing tax reform organizations when favorable to their policies. CTJ is usually well sourced to credible information and uses minimal loaded words. Favors liberal economic policy.

cleantechnica.com.name: Clean Technica
cleantechnica.com.notes: CleanTechnica.com provides news and information about the future of clean technology. They also offer discounts on solar energy. The news reporting is evidence based and neutral in wording. We rate this source left-center specifically because promotion of clean energy is considered more a part of the left wing platform.

cnbc.com.name: CNBC
cnbc.com.notes: CNBC is an American basic cable, internet and satellite business news television channel that is owned by NBCUniversal News Group.  It primarily reports on financial news, but does cover politics and news headlines with a left-center bias.

cjr.org.name: Columbia Journalism Review
cjr.org.notes: The Columbia Journalism Review (CJR) is an American magazine for professional journalists published by the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism since 1961. Its contents include news and media industry trends, analysis, professional ethics and stories behind news.  CJR provides well sourced information with a left-center bias in reporting choices and political affiliation.

commonwealthfund.org.name: Commonwealth Fund
commonwealthfund.org.notes: A private U.S. foundation whose stated purpose is to “promote a high performing health care system that achieves better access.  Founded in 1918. Evidence based reporting with a left of center political affiliation.

councilforthenationalinterest.org.name: Council for the National Interest
councilforthenationalinterest.org.notes: The Council for the National Interest (“CNI”) is a 501(c)(4) nonprofit, non-partisan organization in the United States that works for “Middle East policies that serve the American national interest”. CNI has a pro-Palestine position and is opposed to Neo-Conservatism.  CNI is well sourced and reports factually. They have a left of center bias in reporting choices and political affiliation that is opposed to anti-Islam policy.

credoaction.com.name: Credo Action
credoaction.com.notes: Credo Action is a part of the Credo Mobile Network, which has created an online network of more than 3 million activists who take actions both online and offline.  Credo Action organizes for progressive change through the use of campaigns in which they collect signatures for petitions.  Most petitions are for liberals causes.  They also have a news feed that derives news from mostly left of center sources.

crosscut.com.name: Crosscut.com
crosscut.com.notes: Crosscut.com is a nonprofit, online newspaper based in Seattle, Washington, United States. Crosscut’s stated purpose is to “produce journalism in the public interest.” Its content is mainly news analysis rather than breaking news like other online newspapers or blogs. Most articles are well sourced. There is slight use of loaded words that lean left.

ctvnews.ca.name: CTV News
ctvnews.ca.notes: CTV News Channel is Canada’s 24-hour all-news network. Has a left-Center bias in reporting.

dcreport.org.name: DCReport.org
dcreport.org.notes: DCReport.org is a news and opinion website that covers The President and Congress. It was founded by David Cay Boyle Johnston who is an American investigative journalist and author, a specialist in economics and tax issues, and winner of the 2001 Pulitzer Prize for Beat Reporting. The DCReport has a left-center bias in reporting choices and occasionally uses loaded words in the headlines. The articles themselves are well researched and factual based on proper sourcing.

deadline.com.name: Deadline Hollywood
deadline.com.notes: Deadline Hollywood mostly covers entertainment news, however they do occasionally cover politics.  Deadline typically has a left-center political bias in reporting.

democratandchronicle.com.name: Democrat and Chronicle
democratandchronicle.com.notes: The Democrat and Chronicle is a daily newspaper serving the greater Rochester, New York area.  The Democrat and Chronicle is Rochester’s only daily circulated newspaper. Factual reporting with a left of center editorial bias.

denverpost.com.name: Denver Post
denverpost.com.notes: The Denver Post is a daily newspaper that has been published in Denver, Colorado, United States, since 1892. The Denver Post has won nine Pulitzer Prizes according to Wikipedia. The Denver Post produces well sourced journalism with a left of center bias in reporting and editorial position.

freep.com.name: Detroit Free Press
freep.com.notes: The Detroit Free Press is the largest daily newspaper in Detroit, Michigan, USA. The Free Press has received ten Pulitzer Prizes and four Emmy Awards. High quality journalism with a left of center bias in story selection and editorial content.

digg.com.name: Digg
digg.com.notes: Digg is a news aggregator with a curated front page, aiming to select stories specifically for the Internet audience such as science, trending political issues, and viral Internet issues. Digg’s curated news articles typically come from left-center biased sources according to our ratings. Their science articles are taken from pro-science sources. Overall, the editorial bias of this website is left-center with factual reporting.

dutchdailynews.com.name: Dutch Daily News
dutchdailynews.com.notes: Dutch Daily News is an English language online news source from the Netherlands.  It is well sourced with a moderate liberal bias.

dw.com/en/top-stories/s-9097.name: DW News
dw.com/en/top-stories/s-9097.notes: Deutsche Welle or DW is Germany’s international broadcaster. The service is aimed towards audiences outside of Germany and is available via television, radio and the Internet. Factual reporting with mild liberal bias.

eastbaytimes.com.name: East Bay Times
eastbaytimes.com.notes: The East Bay Times, formerly the Contra Costa Times is a daily newspaper based in Walnut Creek, California, U.S.. The East Bay Times sources to credible information and delivers news with mostly minimal bias. However, the East Bay Times does have a left leaning editorial stance and therefore we rate them Left-Center.

edmontonjournal.com.name: Edmonton Journal
edmontonjournal.com.notes: The Edmonton Journal is a daily newspaper in Edmonton, Alberta. It is part of the Postmedia Network.

elpais.com/elpais/inenglish.html.name: El Pais
elpais.com/elpais/inenglish.html.notes: El País is the highest-circulation daily newspaper in Spain and one of three Madrid dailies considered to be national newspapers of record for Spain (along with El Mundo and ABC). El País, based in Madrid, is owned by the Spanish media conglomerate PRISA.

elpasotimes.com.name: El Paso Times
elpasotimes.com.notes: The El Paso Times is the newspaper for the U.S. city of El Paso, Texas. The paper is currently the only English-language daily in El Paso. Good sourcing with a left-center reporting bias.

emirates247.com.name: Emirates 24/7
emirates247.com.notes: Emirates 24|7 and Emirates 24/7 are a Dubai Media Incorporated news website and television news program, respectively. Has a nationalistic bias, but reports USA and International news with a slight left wing bias.

emptywheel.net.name: Empty Wheel
emptywheel.net.notes: Empty Wheel is a news and opinion website founded by Marcy Wheeler who is best known for her coverage of the Scooter Libby trial. Empty Wheel presents news with a left center bias in reporting. Most stories favor the political left, but are always factually sourced. There is moderate use of loaded words, but not significant enough to classify this site as purely left biased.

engadget.com.name: Engadget
engadget.com.notes: Engadget is a multilingual technology blog network with daily coverage of gadgets and consumer electronics. Engadget does not report a lot on politics, but when they do they have a left-center reporting bias.

euractiv.com.name: Euractiv
euractiv.com.notes: EurActiv is an independent European media platform specializing in the online publication of articles dealing with European news and European-centric topics. It is present across 12 EU capitals.  Does not always adhere to scientific consensus and sometimes publishes misleading headlines.

euobserver.com.name: EU Observer
euobserver.com.notes: EUobserver is an independent online newspaper established in Brussels in 2000. It is financially and editorially independent of the EU institutions. EUobserver’s team of journalists file daily news reports from the EU capital and do in-depth investigations on topics of special interest. Has left-center bias in reporting. Does not use loaded words and is typically well sourced.

factmyth.com.name: Fact/Myth
factmyth.com.notes: Fact/Myth is a very new website to the fact checking genre. Is fact checking a genre now? Regardless, Fact/Myth sources everything and is very accurate in their claims. However, they do use loaded words to describe conservatives such as Donald Trump. For example in this article: Donald Trump has a lot in Common With Tyrants, Classically Speaking they build the case to compare him to ruthless dictators. While they did a great job of sourcing, it still is a stretch to compare Trump after 60 days in office to Hitler, which to their credit they do disclaim. With that said, this article was very deeply researched and effective. It seems the opinion of the author may lean left, but the meat of the facts is dead on. We rate them Left-Center for bias, but high for factual reporting and sourcing. This is a good source that we will keep our eye on and hopefully move to least biased if they change their language in articles.

fair.org.name: Fairness & Accuracy in Reporting (FAIR)
fair.org.notes: Fairness and Accuracy In Reporting (FAIR) is a progressive media criticism organization based in New York City. The organization was founded in 1986 by Jeff Cohen and Martin A. Lee. FAIR describes itself as “the national media watch group”. The organization has been described as both progressive and left-wing.

fairvote.org.name: FairVote
fairvote.org.notes: FairVote (formerly the Center for Voting and Democracy) is a 501(c)(3) organization that advocates electoral reform in the United States. FairVote advocates the use of Ranked choice voting (RCV), in elections. Under this system, voters rank candidates in order of preference, in contrast to the more widely used plurality voting system.  FairVote also wants to abolish the electoral college. All information is well sourced and uses neutral wording. We rate this source left-center primarily because more liberal organizations endorse this voting system.

feministfrequency.com.name: Feminist Frequency
feministfrequency.com.notes: Feminist Frequency is a not-for-profit site that analyzes the media’s relationship to gender, race, and sexuality, and advocates for “inclusive and representative media.” There is feminist commentary on events and news, which is referenced from credible sources. We couldn’t find any articles written on the hot button issues like abortion, gay rights etc. Rather they seem to be more focused on positive, strong representations of women in media – tv, games, videos, film, etc. (F. Locke Siewert)

fivethirtyeight.com.name: FiveThirtyEight
fivethirtyeight.com.notes: FiveThirtyEight, sometimes referred to as 538, is a website that focuses on opinion poll analysis, politics, economics, and sports blogging. The website, which takes its name from the number of electors in the United States electoral college, was founded on March 7, 2008, as a polling aggregation website with a blog created by analyst Nate Silver. FiveThirtyEight typically relies on its methodology and not opinion for its reports, however they do publish new stories that have a slight left-center bias in coverage.

france24.com/en.name: France24
france24.com/en.notes: France 24 is a 24-hour non-stop international news and current affairs television channel based in Paris, and broadcasts in French, English, and Arabic. The stated mission of the three channels is to “provide a global public service and a common editorial stance.” France 24 is excellent at delivering breaking news. They have a left of center bias in reporting.

freakonomics.com.name: Freakonomics Radio
freakonomics.com.notes: Freakonomics Radio is an American public radio program which discusses socioeconomic issues for a general audience. The show is a spin-off of the 2005 book Freakonomics. Journalist Stephen Dubner hosts the show, with economist Steven Levitt as a regular guest. The show is also distributed as a podcast, and is among the most popular on iTunes. Freakonomics is well sourced to credible information and has a left-center political bias in reporting.

freepress.net.name: Free Press
freepress.net.notes: Free Press is a United States advocacy group. It gives the following mission statement: “We fight to save the free and open Internet, curb runaway media consolidation, protect press freedom, and ensure diverse voices are represented in our media.” The group is a major supporter of net neutrality. Free Press offers access to government and communications business documents which are unbiased. However, this source also has a blog that has a considerable left wing bias in reporting and use of loaded words. We rate the site factual for information and left wing biased for opinion, which scores as left-center by our methodology.

fresnobee.com.name: Fresno Bee
fresnobee.com.notes: The Fresno Bee is a daily newspaper serving Fresno, California, and surrounding counties in that U.S. state’s San Joaquin Valley. It is owned by The McClatchy Company and ranks fourth in circulation among the company’s newspapers. Reports factually with sources and has a left of center editorial bias.

fusion.net.name: Fusion
fusion.net.notes: Fusion is a media company that has a TV station and a website. Fusion’s primary focus is on on pop culture and occasionally hard news.  Fusion also publishes satire, which can make it difficult to tell which is real or not. When publishing real news Fusion has a liberal bias, but it is typically sourced.  We could have placed this source in our satire group, but felt since they do publish legitimate content they belong as a real source. Use this site with caution when looking for real news.

greensboro.com.name: Greensboro News and Record
greensboro.com.notes: The News & Record is the largest newspaper serving Guilford County, North Carolina and the surrounding region. It is based in Greensboro, North Carolina and produces local sections for Greensboro and Rockingham County, North Carolina. As of September 30, 2011, it had an average weekday circulation of about 54,789 and an average Sunday circulation of about 81,600. The News & Record is also the third largest paper in North Carolina after the News & Observer and Charlotte Observer. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

glamour.com.name: Glamour Magazine
glamour.com.notes: Glamour is a women’s magazine published by Condé Nast Publications. Founded in 1939 and first published in April 1939 in the United States, it was originally called Glamour of Hollywood. The Glamour website has a news and culture section in which they publish political news. All news articles are well sourced and grounded in fact. There is a left-center bias in reporting choices that sometimes utilizes loaded words to convey emotion. Many political news articles are not favorable toward conservatives.

globalnews.ca.name: Global News
globalnews.ca.notes: Global News is the news and current affairs division of Global Television Network in Canada, overseeing all local and national news programming on the network’s twelve owned-and-operated stations. Global News provides evidence based sourced news. They  do have a left-center leaning when it comes to story selection that slightly favors liberals and occasional emotional words that convey mild bias.

pri.org/programs/globalpost.name: Global Post
pri.org/programs/globalpost.notes: Global Post is an online US digital journalism company that focuses on international news founded on January 12, 2009 by Philip S. Balboni and Charles M. Sennott.  GlobalPost has syndication agreements with PBS and CBS. As part of the PBS partnership, Global Post correspondents began producing video segments for airing on The PBS NewsHour. Well sourced and factual.  Some liberal bias in reporting.

globaltimes.cn.name: Global Times (China)
globaltimes.cn.notes: The Global Times is a daily Chinese newspaper that focuses on international issues.  Although they have a very strong pro-government slant they do report USA news with a mild left of center bias.

governing.com.name: Governing Magazine
governing.com.notes: Governing is a national monthly magazine, edited and published since 1987 in Washington, D.C., whose subject area is state and local government in the United States. The magazine covers policy, politics and the management of government enterprises. Its subject areas include such issues as government finance, land use, economic development, the environment, technology and transportation. Governing has a left of center bias in reporting and is well sourced.

grist.org.name: Grist
grist.org.notes: Grist (originally Grist Magazine; also referred to as Grist.org) is an American non-profit online magazine that has been publishing environmental news and commentary since 1999. Grist is a Pro-Science magazine that focuses on environmental issues. Due to their left leaning political bias regarding environmental policy we place them in the Left-Center category rather than Pro-Science.

haaretz.com.name: Haaretz
haaretz.com.notes: Haaretz is Israel’s oldest daily newspaper. It was founded in 1918 and is now published in both Hebrew and English in Berliner format. The English edition is published and sold together with the International New York Times. Both Hebrew and English editions can be read on the Internet. In North America, it comes out as a weekly newspaper, combining articles from the Friday edition with a roundup from the rest of the week. It is known for its  left-wing and liberal stances on domestic and foreign issues.

harpers.org.name: Harpers
harpers.org.notes: Harper’s Magazine (also called Harper’s) is a monthly magazine of literature, politics, culture, finance, and the arts. Launched in June 1850, it is the second-oldest continuously published monthly magazine in the U.S. Very high level of journalism and factual.

courant.com.name: The Hartford Courant
courant.com.notes: The Hartford Courant is the largest daily newspaper in the U.S. state of Connecticut, and is often recognized as the oldest continuously published newspaper in the United States. Factual reporting, left-center editorial stance.

heavy.com.name: Heavy
heavy.com.notes: Heavy.com is a news and information website based in New York City.  Heavy.com is self-described as “a real-time news and information portal”, and, on its site, claims to reach “35 million unique visitors per month.” Has a left of center bias in reporting and story selection.  Sometimes jumps the gun on breaking news and has to retract.

helsinkitimes.fi.name: Helsinki Times
helsinkitimes.fi.notes: Helsinki Times is the first English language daily online newspaper in Finland providing news about Finland and the world for English-speaking readers resident in the country. Helsinki Times reports factually and has a left-center bias in reporting.

historynewsnetwork.org.name: History News Network
historynewsnetwork.org.notes: The History News Network is a non-profit corporation registered in Washington State. The editor and founder of HNN is Rick Shenkman; its Advisory Board includes other academic scholars such as historians Gil Troy and Joyce Appleby, and Leonard Steinhorn. The mission of HNN is to help readers put the news into historical perspective. Reports with minimal loaded words and sources well. Has a left-center political bias in reporting.

hollywoodreporter.com.name: Hollywood Reporter
hollywoodreporter.com.notes: Primarily an entertainment media source, but does report on politics with a left-center bias.

staradvertiser.com.name: Honolulu Star-Advertiser
staradvertiser.com.notes: The Honolulu Star-Advertiser is the largest daily newspaper in Hawaii, formed in 2010 with the merger of The Honolulu Advertiser and the Honolulu Star-Bulletin. Factual reporting with a left of center editorial bias.

chron.com.name: Houston Chronicle
chron.com.notes: The Houston Chronicle is the largest daily newspaper in Houston, Texas, United States. Factual reporting with left-center editorial bias.

hrw.org.name: Human Rights Watch
hrw.org.notes: Human Rights Watch (HRW) is an American-founded international non-governmental organization that conducts research and advocacy on human rights. HRW reports factually and with minimal loaded words. This source has a left-center bias though opposition to some Republican policies such as the Muslim Ban and the Mexican Border Wall.

hurriyetdailynews.com.name: Hurriyet Daily News
hurriyetdailynews.com.notes: The Hürriyet Daily News, formerly Hürriyet Daily News and Economic Review and Turkish Daily News, is the oldest current English-language daily in Turkey, founded in 1961. Hürriyet Daily News takes a secular and liberal or center-left position on most political issues, in contrast to its two main competitors, Today’s Zaman and the Daily Sabah, which is closely aligned with the Justice and Development Party of Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.

icenews.is.name: Ice News
icenews.is.notes: IceNews is an Icelandic based news outlet. It specializes in providing English-language news on the Nordic countries of Denmark, the Faroe Islands, Finland, Greenland, Iceland, Norway, Sweden and elsewhere in northern Europe, primarily the United Kingdom. It publishes articles on current affairs, politics, entertainment, culture, travel and forthcoming events.

ifamericaknew.org.name: If America Knew
ifamericaknew.org.notes: If Americans Knew (IAK) features news and reports exclusively regarding the current situation in Israeli occupied Palestine. Founded by Alison Weir, IAK’s goal is, as stated on the site: “The mission of If Americans Knew is to inform and educate the American public on issues of major significance that are unreported, underreported, or misreported in the American media.”

indymedia.org/or/index.shtml.name: Independent Media Center
indymedia.org/or/index.shtml.notes: The Independent Media Center (also known as Indymedia or IMC) is a global open publishing network of journalist collectives that report on political and social issues. It is closely associated with the global justice movement, which criticizes neo-liberalism and its associated institutions. Indymedia uses democratic media process that allows anybody to contribute. Due to publishing being open some stories may not be sourced properly.

indystar.com.name: Indianapolis Star
indystar.com.notes: The Indianapolis Star is a morning daily newspaper that began publishing on June 6, 1903. It has won the Pulitzer Prize for Investigative Reporting twice, in 1975 and 1991. It is currently owned by the Gannett Company. Has left-center bias in editorial stance and is well sourced.

inquisitr.com/news.name: Inquisitr
inquisitr.com/news.notes: Inquisitr is an aggregate news and media website owned by Daniel Treisman, an Israeli businessman who relaunched the website in 2011. The site views itself as a ‘multi-news aggregator’ that publishes both trending news and original articles. The news website caters to a global audience.  Has a left-center bias on their original content.

insidehighered.com.name: Inside Higher Ed
insidehighered.com.notes: Inside Higher Ed is a daily online publication focused on college and university topics, based in Washington, D.C., United States. While most of the reporting is about news within the field of higher education, they do occasionally cover politics with a left of center bias in reporting and affiliation.

icrw.org.name: International Center for Research on Women
icrw.org.notes: The International Center for Research on Women (ICRW) is a non-profit organization headquartered in Washington, D.C., United States, with a regional office in New Delhi, India. ICRW has project offices in Mumbai and Hyderabad India, and is establishing a formal presence in East Africa. ICRW works to promote gender equitable development within the field of international development.

crisisgroup.org.name: International Crisis Group
crisisgroup.org.notes: The International Crisis Group (Crisis Group) is a transnational non-profit, non-governmental organization founded in 1995 that carries out field research on violent conflict and advances policies to prevent, mitigate or resolve conflict. It advocates policies directly with governments, multilateral organisations and other political actors as well as the media. Crisis Group has a left-center bias in reporting and is factual.

ipolitics.ca.name: iPolitics
ipolitics.ca.notes: iPolitics covers Canadian politics and news.  They have a very mild left of center bias and are factual in reporting from credible sources.

jointcenter.org.name: Joint Center for Political and Economic Studies
jointcenter.org.notes: A U.S. national, nonprofit institution that conducts research on public policy issues of special concern to African Americans.

helvidius.org.name: Journal of Politics and Society
helvidius.org.notes: The Journal of Politics & Society is an academic journal of the social sciences published twice a year by the Helvidius Group, a nonprofit student organization at Columbia University. Has a left-center bias in reporting and is factual.

kansascity.com.name: Kansas City Star
kansascity.com.notes: The Kansas City Star is a newspaper based in Kansas City, Missouri, in the United States. Published since 1880, the paper is the recipient of eight Pulitzer Prizes. Reports factually and has a left-center editorial bias.

knightfoundation.org.name: Knight Foundation
knightfoundation.org.notes: The John S. and James L. Knight Foundation is an American private, non-profit foundation dedicated to supporting “transformational ideas that promote quality journalism, advance media innovation, engage communities and foster the arts.”

kmov.com.name: KMOV
kmov.com.notes: KMOV is a CBS–affiliated television station and website located in St. Louis, Missouri, United States. KMOV delivers news with minimal bias and is factual. The editorial position of KMOV is Left-Center.

latimes.com.name: LA Times (Los Angeles Times)
latimes.com.notes: The Los Angeles Times, commonly referred to as the Times or LA Times, is a paid daily newspaper published in Los Angeles, California, since 1881. It was the largest metropolitan newspaper in circulation in the United States in 2008 and the fourth most widely distributed newspaper in the country. Well sourced with a left-center editorial bias.

lawfareblog.com.name: Lawfare Blog
lawfareblog.com.notes: Lawfare Blog is a blog dedicated to national security issues, published by the Lawfare Institute in cooperation with the Brookings Institution. Lawfare Blog is factual in reporting and always well sourced. There is a left-center bias in reporting choices that slightly favor liberals. Overall, this is a reliable source for security and legal information.

lawnewz.com.name: Law Newz
lawnewz.com.notes: Law Newz is founded and run by Dan Abrams, who is currently the Chief Legal Anchor for ABC News, and host of both 60 Days In and Live PD on the A&E network. Has a slight left bias in reporting, but is well source.

leftjustified.com.name: Left Justified
leftjustified.com.notes: Left Justified is a news and opinion website with a left leaning bias in reporting. Left Justified does not have many articles posted and seems to be quite inactive. Of the articles posted all are well sourced and factual with minimal loaded words. They lean left in story selection that tends to favor liberals, otherwise this source is pretty solid.

lethbridgeherald.com.name: Lethbridge Herald
lethbridgeherald.com.notes: The Lethbridge Herald is the leading daily newspaper in greater Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada. Well sourced reporting with a left-center editorial position.

kentucky.com.name: Lexington Herald Leader
kentucky.com.notes: The Lexington Herald-Leader is a newspaper owned by The McClatchy Company and based in the U.S. city of Lexington, Kentucky.  The newspaper has won the 1986 Pulitzer Prize for Investigative Reporting, the 1992 Pulitzer Prize for Editorial Writing and the 2000 Pulitzer Prize for Editorial Cartooning. It had also been a finalist in six other Pulitzer awards in the 22-year period up until its sale in 2006, a record that was unsurpassed by any mid-sized newspaper in the United States during the same time frame. The Lexington Herald Leader reports accurately and is well sourced. They have a left-center editorial bias and endorse Democratic candidates.

liveleak.com.name: LiveLeak
liveleak.com.notes: Liveleak is a video service founded by Hayden Hewitt. The content is almost exclusively user submitted videos and covers a wide range of topics from around the world. From people’s pets to Rex Tillerson’s trip to Asia. Because of the conflicts in Syria and the Ukraine, and the amount of video being uploaded from there, they currently have two sections dedicated to them.  Due to being a video sharing service, and the videos being presented as submitted, the content can be very graphic and controversial, such as when Liveleak hosted footage of the beheading of journalist James Foley by ISIS in 2014. Mr. Hewitt has defended the practice of presenting submitted footage as is, stating in his own words:

medium.com.name: Medium
medium.com.notes: Medium is an online publishing platform developed by Twitter co-founder Evan Williams, and launched in August 2012. It is legally owned by A Medium Corporation. The platform is an example of evolved social journalism, having a hybrid collection of amateur and professional people and publications, or exclusive blogs or publishers on Medium and is regularly regarded as a blog host. We really are not sure where to place this source.  Medium has a variety of writers from many different political perspectives.  We sampled 10 top stories and 6 out of 10 leaned left. That doesn’t mean it represents the entirety of the site.  We gave this source a mixed factual reporting rating because many authors on Medium are not journalists.

metro.us.name: Metro
metro.us.notes: The Metro is published in more than 100 major cities across Europe, North & South America and Asia and reaches an audience of 18 million daily. Designed for a 20-minute read, the paper gives metropolitans all they need to know, Monday through Friday, during their morning commutes. Metro sources properly and is factual. There is a left-center bias in reporting and editorial content.

metro.co.uk.name: Metro UK
metro.co.uk.notes: Metro is a free newspaper published in tabloid format in the United Kingdom by DMG Media (part of Daily Mail and General Trust). The Metro primarily covers entertainment and local news, but also occasionally politics with a left-center bias in wording and story selection.

mexiconewsdaily.com.name: Mexico Daily News
mexiconewsdaily.com.notes: Curates news stories from Mexico in English.  Bias is determined by the sources they curate.

miamiherald.com.name: Miami Herald
miamiherald.com.notes: The Miami Herald is a daily newspaper owned by the McClatchy Company and headquartered in Doral, Florida, a city in western Miami-Dade County several miles west of Miami.  Founded in 1903, it is the second largest newspaper in South Florida, serving Miami-Dade, Broward County, and Monroe County. It also circulates throughout Latin America and the Caribbean.

mic.com.name: Mic
mic.com.notes: Mic (formerly PolicyMic) is a media company that targets millennials. The company reaches 19 million unique monthly visitors and has a higher composition of 18- to 34-year-old readers than any other millennial-focused news site, including BuzzFeed and Vice. Mic has a left of center bias in reporting, but they are factual and source to other credible sources.

jsonline.com.name: Milwaukee Journal-Sentinel
jsonline.com.notes: The Milwaukee Journal Sentinel is a daily morning broadsheet printed in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. It is the primary newspaper in Milwaukee, the largest newspaper in Wisconsin and is distributed widely throughout the state. It is owned by the Gannett Company.  Gets its news from the USA Network which is centrist, but has a left-center editorial bias.

startribune.com.name: Minneapolis Star Tribune
startribune.com.notes: The Star Tribune is the largest newspaper in the U.S. state of Minnesota. Is well sourced with a left-center editorial bias.

mintpressnews.com.name: Mint Press News
mintpressnews.com.notes: MintPress News is an independent Minnesota-based news website launched in 2012. It covers political, economic, foreign affairs and environmental issues. Mint Press has a left wing bias in reporting, but is well source and evidence based in reporting.

monthlyreview.org.name: Monthly Review
monthlyreview.org.notes: The Monthly Review, established in 1949, is an independent socialist magazine published monthly in New York City. As of 2015 the publication remains the longest continuously published socialist magazine in the United States. The journal has an impact factor of 0.460.  Has an obvious left wing political bias, but as an academic journal is evidence based.

montrealgazette.com.name: Montreal Gazette
montrealgazette.com.notes: A daily English newspaper from Montreal, Canada.  Canada’s oldest newspaper. Has a left-center editorial bias.

morningconsult.com.name: Morning Consult
morningconsult.com.notes: Morning Consult is a nonpartisan digital media and survey research company established in 2013.  The company provides news coverage, survey research, and data technology tools on issues in politics, policy and business.  Morning Consult is the official polling partner of POLITICO, Vox, Fortune, and Bloomberg News. Very evidence based reporting, with just slight left of center bias in story selection.

themoscowtimes.com.name: Moscow Times
themoscowtimes.com.notes: The Moscow Times (MT) is an English-language weekly newspaper published in Moscow, with a circulation of 35,000 copies. It is distributed for free at places frequented by English-speaking expatriates such as hotels, cafés, embassies, and airlines. It is also available by subscription, but it is not available at newsstands. The newspaper is very popular among foreign citizens residing in Moscow and English-speaking Russians. The Moscow Times has been called a “militant anti-Putin paper, a digest of the Western press with extreme bias in covering events in Russia.” MT generally covers Western news with a left-center bias in reporting and wording. They are usually factually sourced.

msn.com.name: MSN.com
msn.com.notes: MSN is a web portal and related collection of Internet services and apps for Windows and mobile devices, provided by Microsoft and launched on August 24, 1995, the same release date as Windows 95. MSN aggregates news from a wide variety of mainstream sources. Most news comes from left-center and least biased sources. Based on the majority of news coming from left-center sources we rate MSN left-center for content and reporting.

nationalnewswatch.com.name: National Newswatch
nationalnewswatch.com.notes: National Newswatch is a Canadian news service that primary aggregates news content from other sources. Most news content is from left-center sources such as the CBC and the Globe and Mail. National Newswatch also has an opinion page that publishes opinion pieces from other Canadian media outlets. Again, these typically come from left-center sources. We rate National Newswatch left-center for reporting bias and factual based on the sources the link to.

nationalobserver.com.name: National Observer (Canada)
nationalobserver.com.notes: National Observer is a Canadian online website focused on news through the lens of energy, environment, and federal politics. The publication emphasizes quality investigations, federal politics, breaking news, opinion, and analysis. The National Observer has a left wing political bias as it relates to environmental positions and liberal policy. National Observer is well sourced and factual in reporting.

resourcegovernance.org.name: Natural Resource Governance Institute
resourcegovernance.org.notes: Monitors economic reconstruction in the country, focusing on the oil industry, to ensure it is managed responsibly.

nbcnews.com.name: NBC News
nbcnews.com.notes: NBC News is considered a mainstream media source. NBC News is a division of the American broadcast network NBC. The division operates under NBCUniversal News Group, a subsidiary of NBC Universal, all owned by Comcast. Has a left-center bias in reporting and story choices. NBC News is well sourced and factual.

ncpolicywatch.com.name: NC Policy Watch
ncpolicywatch.com.notes: NC Policy Watch‘ is a North Carolina public-policy think tank co-founded by Chris Fitzsimon and the A.J. Fletcher Foundation. The organization works in numerous public policy fields including issues of poverty, health care, mental health issues, transportation, and tax reform. NC Policy Watch has moderate left-center bias in reporting as they support mostly progressive causes. All information is well sourced and factual.

news.com.au.name: News.com.au
news.com.au.notes: News.com.au is an Australian news and entertainment website owned by News Corp Australia. It specializes in breaking national and international news as well as entertainment, sport, lifestyle, travel, technology and finance. News.com.au has a left-center bias though story selection and political editorial bias. They are well sourced and factual.

newsday.com.name: Newsday
newsday.com.notes: Newsday is an American daily newspaper that primarily serves Nassau and Suffolk counties and the New York City borough of Queens on Long Island, although it is sold throughout the New York metropolitan area. Newsday has a left wing editorial bias, but reports with credible sourcing.

newsone.com.name: NewsOne
newsone.com.notes: NewsOne is a news and opinion website that focuses on news about Blacks in America. NewsOne has a moderate left wing bias in wording and story choices, but balance this with well sourced factual reporting.

newsweek.com.name: Newsweek
newsweek.com.notes: Newsweek is an American weekly news magazine founded in 1933.  Over the last few years its content has shifted more to the left.  If this trend continues this source may move to Left bias.

newsy.com.name: Newsy
newsy.com.notes: Newsy is a video news network that produces short-form video news pieces that provide breaking news and updates across U.S. and world news, policy and politics, science and health, entertainment, technology, business and sports.

newleftreview.org.name: New Left Review
newleftreview.org.notes: The New Left Review is a bimonthly political academic journal covering world politics, economy, and culture which was established in 1960. In 2003, the magazine ranked 12th by impact factor on a list of the top 20 political science journals in the world. Has very high standards of journalism with a moderate left bias in reporting.

newmatilda.com.name: New Matilda
newmatilda.com.notes: Newmatilda.com, commonly known as New Matilda, is a left-wing independent Australian website of news, analysis and satire.

newmoderate.com.name: New Moderate
newmoderate.com.notes: Although this source claims to be centrist, most of the wording and reporting has a slight left of center of bias.

nydailynews.com.name: New York Daily News
nydailynews.com.notes: The New York Daily News is an American newspaper based in New York City. It is the fourth-most widely circulated daily newspaper in the United States. It was founded in 1919, and was the first U.S. daily printed in tabloid format. Publishes news with sensational headlines that do not always match the story.

newsandgutsmedia.com.name: News and Guts
newsandgutsmedia.com.notes: News and Guts is an independent media company founded by long time news journalist Dan Rather. The website features writings by Dan Rather that is well sourced and well written. Has a left-center political bias in reporting only.

npr.org/sections/news.name: NPR (National Public Radio)
npr.org/sections/news.notes: National Public Radio usually shortened to NPR, is an American privately and publicly funded non-profit membership media organization that serves as a national syndicator to a network of 900 public radio stations in the United States of America.  Very centrist in reporting. Very factual.  Has a liberal editorial bias.

nytimes.com.name: New York Times
nytimes.com.notes: The New York Times (sometimes abbreviated to NYT) is an American daily newspaper, founded and continuously published in New York City since September 18, 1851, by The New York Times Company. The New York Times has won 117 Pulitzer Prizes, more than any other news organization. NYT is well sourced and factual in reporting.  The paper has a pretty strong left wing editorial bias, but is considered one of the most reliable sources for information.

oilandwaterdontmix.org.name: Oil and Water Don’t Mix
oilandwaterdontmix.org.notes: Oil and Water Don’t Mix is a number of organizations and citizens across Michigan who are working to keep oil out of the Great Lakes. Reports factually on the situation of pipelines that effect the lake. Has a left-center environmental bias in reporting.

opendemocracy.net.name: openDemocracy
opendemocracy.net.notes: openDemocracy is an independent global media platform covering world affairs, ideas and culture which seeks to challenge power and encourage democratic debate across the world. openDemocracy was founded in 2000 by Anthony Barnett, David Hayes, Susan Richards and Paul Hilder. Publishing started in May 2001. Prominent contributors have included Kofi Annan, George Soros, Ayaan Hirsi Ali, Shirin Ebadi, Sidney Blumenthal, Peter Hain, Pierre Bourdieu, Manuel Castells, Fred Halliday, and David Blunkett. openDemocracy’s mission statement asserts: “openDemocracy is committed to human rights and democracy. We aim to ensure that marginalised views and voices are heard. We believe facilitating argument and understanding across geographical boundaries is vital to preventing injustice”. openDemocracy has a left bias in reporting and political affiliation, however all articles are well sourced and evidence based. The evidence based reporting helps balance the progressive bias and therefore we rate this source Left-Center. Special note: some articles do swing far left, but others are balanced so one must judge on a per article basis.

opposingviews.com.name: Opposing Views
opposingviews.com.notes: Opposing Views (also known as OV) is an American digital news website headquartered in Los Angeles.  The site presents original and aggregated news articles from across the political spectrum.  Through our article sampling there were more articles that leaned left based on reporting choices and wording. All information is sourced.

ozy.com.name: Ozy Media
ozy.com.notes: OZY Media is an international online magazine that focuses on news, arts, culture, politics, business and sports. OZY was launched in September 2013 by former MSNBC news anchor, journalist, and businessman Carlos Watson. Ozy produces well sourced content that is factually based with a left-center bias in report choices and wording.

panampost.com.name: PanAm Post
panampost.com.notes: The PanAm Post is an American news and analysis website that specializes in international subjects as well as topics in the Americas. The website focuses on multilingual and international content in order to follow “the tradition of Pan-Americanism”. It was founded in 2013 and its headquarters is in Miami, Florida.

pbs.org/newshour.name: PBS News Hour
pbs.org/newshour.notes: The PBS NewsHour is an American daily evening television news program that is broadcast on the Public Broadcasting Service (PBS), airing seven nights a week on more than 300 of the public broadcaster’s member stations. As the nation’s first hour-long nightly news broadcast, the program is known for its in-depth coverage of issues and current events. PBS produces high quality journalism that is sourced and factual. They have a left-center bias in reporting.

philly.com/inquirer.name: Philadelphia Inquirer
philly.com/inquirer.notes: The Philadelphia Inquirer is a morning daily newspaper that serves the Philadelphia, metropolitan area of the United States. Is factual in reporting, with a left-center editorial bias.

inquirer.net.name: Philippine Daily Inquirer
inquirer.net.notes: The Philippine Daily Inquirer, popularly known as the Inquirer, is the most widely read broadsheet newspaper in the Philippines, with a daily circulation of 260,000 copies. The Philippine Daily Inquirer reports international news with minimal bias and is factually sourced. Has left of center editorial bias.

post-gazette.com.name: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
post-gazette.com.notes: Daily newspaper from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. The Pittsburgh Post-Gazette is factual in reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

politicalcritique.org.name: Political Critique
politicalcritique.org.notes: Krytyka Polityczna (Political Critique) is the largest Central and Eastern European liberal network of institutions and activists. Has a left of center political bias, but reports with sourcing and evidence.

politico.com.name: Politico
politico.com.notes: Politico is an American political-journalism organization based in Arlington County, Virginia, that covers politics and policy in the United States and internationally. It distributes content via television, the Internet, The Politico newspaper, radio, and podcasts. Its coverage in Washington, D.C., includes the U.S. Congress, lobbying, media and the presidency. Has a left-center bias in reporting.

politicsthatwork.com.name: Politics That Work
politicsthatwork.com.notes: Politics That Work is a website dedicated to providing statistical evidence on political issues such as crime, guns and economy. While we find the information to be credible and accurate, we also find it to be one sided in an attempt to show that Democratic policy is superior. Politics That Works also aggregates news from left and left-center sources. Based on presenting factual information that favors the left we rate this source Left-Center biased.

pressherald.com.name: Portland Press-Herald
pressherald.com.notes: The Portland Press Herald (and Maine Sunday Telegram; collectively known as The Portland Newspapers) publish daily newspapers in the city of Portland, Maine, in the United States . Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

presstv.com.name: Press TV
presstv.com.notes: Press TV is a 24-hour English language news and documentary network, affiliated with Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting (IRIB). IRIB is state-owned but independent of the Iranian government in its management, and is the only legal TV and radio broadcaster inside Iran.  Has a strong Iranian nationalism in reporting.  However, when reporting USA new it has a Left-Center political bias.

propublica.org.name: Propublica
propublica.org.notes: ProPublica is a non-profit corporation based in New York City. It describes itself as an independent non-profit newsroom that produces investigative journalism in the public interest. In 2010 it became the first online news source to win a Pulitzer Prize. Propublica is a highly evidence based source with in-depth investigative journalism. Has a left-center political bias in story selection and occasionally with wording.

prospectmagazine.co.uk.name: Prospect Magazine
prospectmagazine.co.uk.notes: Prospect is a monthly British general interest magazine, specializing in politics, economics and current affairs. It features a mixture of lengthy analytic articles, first-person reportage, one-page columns, and shorter, quirky items. Well sourced journalism with a left-center bias in reporting.

providencejournal.com.name: The Providence Journal
providencejournal.com.notes: Daily newspaper from Providence, Rhode Island. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

pri.org.name: Public Radio International (PRI)
pri.org.notes: Public Radio International (PRI) is a Minneapolis-based American public radio organization, with locations in Boston, New York, London and Beijing. PRI is a media content creator and also distributes programs from many sources, competing with National Public Radio, American Public Media and the Public Radio Exchange to provide programming to public radio stations. This is a strong evidence based source with a left-center bias in reporting and story selection.

putintrump.org.name: PutinTrump.org
putintrump.org.notes: PutinTrump.org aggregates news about USA-Russia relations as it relates to Trump and Putin. They aggregate news from a wide variety of sources with most from our Left-Center bias category and some from Least Biased. Editorially there is a clear left bias against Trump.

qz.com.name: Quartz
qz.com.notes: Quartz (qz.com) is a digital global business news publication. It is owned by Atlantic Media Co., the publisher of The Atlantic, National Journal, and Government Executive.  Quartz targets high-earning readers who traditionally read other left-leaning publications.

rfa.org/english.name: Radio Free Asia
rfa.org/english.notes: Radio Free Asia (RFA) is a private, nonprofit international broadcasting agency of the United States government that broadcasts and publishes online news, information, and commentary to listeners in East Asia while “advancing the goals of U.S. foreign policy.” RFA is funded by the Broadcasting Board of Governors (BBG), an independent agency of the United States government responsible for all non-military, international broadcasting sponsored by the U.S government (such as Radio Free Europe), which appoints the board of RFA. RFA distributes content in nine Asian languages for audiences in six countries. RFA is well sourced and factual in reporting. Has very slight left leaning bias in reporting choices.

newsobserver.com.name: Raleigh News and Observer
newsobserver.com.notes: The News & Observer is a regional daily newspaper that serves the greater Triangle area based In Raleigh. The paper is the second largest in the state after The Charlotte Observer. The paper has also been awarded three Pulitzer Prizes. Has a left of center editorial bias an dis factual in reporting.

rationalwiki.org/wiki/Main_Page.name: RationalWiki
rationalwiki.org/wiki/Main_Page.notes: The purpose of RationalWiki is: Analyzing and refuting pseudoscience and the anti-science movement, documenting the full range of crank ideas, explorations of authoritarianism and fundamentalism, analysis and criticism of how these subjects are handled in the media.  RationalWiki does have a left of center bias in what they choose to list.

therealnews.com/t2.name: Real News Network
therealnews.com/t2.notes: The Real News (TRNN) is a nonprofit, viewer-supported daily video-news and documentary service. TRNN launched in 2007 by Paul Jay, who serves as the network’s CEO and senior editor. TRNN describes itself as a news source “focused on providing independent and uncompromising journalism.” The Real News has a moderate left wing bias that is reflected in its positions on economics.  It generally gives perspective from both sides, but favors more left-wing economics through whom it interviews.

revealnews.org.name: Reveal – Center for Investigative Reporting
revealnews.org.notes: The Center for Investigative Reporting (CIR) is a nonprofit news organization based in Emeryville, California, and has conducted investigative journalism since 1977. It is known for producing stories that reveal scandals or corruption in government agencies and corporations..  Has won numerous high standard journalism awards.

roanoke.com.name: Roanoke Times
roanoke.com.notes: The Roanoke Times is the primary newspaper in Southwestern Virginia and is based in Roanoke, Virginia, United States. It is published by Berkshire Hathaway. The Roanoke Times uses evidence based reporting for the news and has a left-center editorial bias.

rollingstone.com.name: Rolling Stone
rollingstone.com.notes: Rolling Stone is an American biweekly magazine that focuses on popular culture. It was founded in San Francisco in 1967 by Jann Wenner, who is still the magazine’s publisher.  Although Rolling Stone is primarily known as a Music Magazine, it has a long history of cover politics.  Its reporting can be very in-depth and well researched.  Has a left of center bias on most issues.

rooseveltinstitute.org.name: Roosevelt Institute
rooseveltinstitute.org.notes: The Roosevelt Institute is a liberal American think tank. According to the organization, it exists “to carry forward the legacy and values of Franklin and Eleanor Roosevelt by developing progressive ideas and bold leadership in the service of restoring America’s promise of opportunity for all.” It is headquartered in New York, New York. Has a left center political bias in reporting and story selection, but is factually sourced.

rudaw.net/english.name: Rudaw
rudaw.net/english.notes: Rudaw is a Kurdish media network funded and supported by Rudaw Company. The network aims to impart news and information about Kurdistan and the Middle East. Rudaw is based in Erbil, the capital city of the Kurdistan Region of Iraq. The company has correspondents in various parts of the Middle East, Europe and the U.S. Rudaw publishes in the Kurdish dialects Sorani and Kurmanji as well as in English.

sacbee.com.name: Sacramento Bee
sacbee.com.notes: The Sacramento Bee is a daily newspaper published in Sacramento, California, in the United States. Since its founding in 1857, The Bee has become the largest newspaper in Sacramento, the fifth largest newspaper in California, and the 27th largest paper in the U.S. The Sacramento Bee is factually sourced and has a left-center editorial bias.

sltrib.com.name: Salt Lake Tribune
sltrib.com.notes: Daily newspaper from Salt Lake City, Utah. Factual in reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

mysanantonio.com.name: San Antonio Express-News
mysanantonio.com.notes: Daily newspaper from San Antonio, Texas. Has a left-center editorial bias.

sfchronicle.com.name: San Francisco Chronicle
sfchronicle.com.notes: California newspaper from San Francisco. Has a moderate left wing editorial bias with factual, sourced reporting.

mercurynews.com.name: San Jose Mercury News
mercurynews.com.notes: California newspaper from San Jose. The newspaper has earned several awards, including two Pulitzer Prizes. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial stance.

scoopwhoop.com.name: ScoopWhoop
scoopwhoop.com.notes: ScoopWhoop is an internet media and news company from India. The company creates and curates India specific stories. Scoopwhoop features many stories on social issues with little focus on USA news, unless it’s viral, similar to Buzzfeed.  The articles about the USA tend to link to credible sources such as Reuters, however the stories are often misleading due to the use of emotional words or outright false claims.  For example, in an article titled “Russia Vows ‘Adequate Response’ After US Expels 35 Russian Diplomats For ‘Spying’,” Scoopwhoop claims in a quote, that according to the BBC, Russia will “cause the US government ‘significant destruction’“. This simply is not true as Putin never said this and the BBC never reported it.  Overall, this source tends to have a left-center reporting bias and is not always well sourced and factual (M. Allen).

seattlepi.com.name: Seattle Post-Intelligencer
seattlepi.com.notes: The Seattle Post-Intelligencer is an online newspaper and former print newspaper covering Seattle, Washington, United States, and the surrounding metropolitan area. Has a left-center editorial bias.

seattletimes.com.name: Seattle Times
seattletimes.com.notes: Newspaper from Seattle, Washington. The Seattle Times reporting has received 10 Pulitzer Prizes. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

secondnexus.com.name: Second Nexus
secondnexus.com.notes: Second Nexus is website that reports a variety of news.  Has a left of center political bias in reporting.

sfgate.com.name: SFGate
sfgate.com.notes: SFGate is a California web based newspaper from San Francisco. Has a moderate left wing editorial bias with factual, sourced reporting.

news.sky.com.name: Sky News
news.sky.com.notes: Sky News is a 24-hour international multimedia news operation based in Britain. Originally a 24-hour television news channel in the UK, Sky News now provides rolling news on television, online, and on a range of mobile devices. Sky News emphasizes breaking news (Wikipedia).

sojo.net.name: Sojourners (Soho)
sojo.net.notes: Sojourners magazine is a progressive monthly publication of the Christian social justice organization Sojourners, which arose out of the Sojourners Community. It was first published in 1971 under the original title of The Post-American. The magazine publishes editorials and articles on Christianity and politics, the church and social issues, social justice, and Christian living (Wikipedia). Sojourners publishes articles with a left of center bias based on story selection and political affiliation. Soho would be considered a part of the Christian Left. Most articles are well sourced and free from loaded words.

sootoday.com.name: SooToday.com
sootoday.com.notes: SooToday.com is a 24/7 news source from Sault Ste. Marie, Algoma, Northern Ontario. Reports news factually and with good sourcing. There is a left-center editorial bias and some stories tend to favor liberal issues.

splcenter.org.name: Southern Poverty Law Center
splcenter.org.notes: The Southern Poverty Law Center is an American nonprofit legal advocacy organization specializing in civil rights and public interest litigation. It is noted for its legal victories against white supremacist groups and its legal representation for victims of hate groups.  The SPLC also classifies and lists hate groups—organizations that in its opinion “attack or malign an entire class of people, typically for their immutable characteristics. The SPLC has been accused of having a far left bias by hate groups and other questionable far right sources. We rate SPLC left-center in bias through reporting choices.

sbs.com.au.name: Special Broadcasting Service (SBS)
