sciencemag.org.notes: Science, also widely referred to as Science Magazine, is the peer-reviewed academic journal of the American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS) and one of the world’s top academic journals.

scientificamerican.com.name: Scientific American
scientificamerican.com.notes: Scientific American is an American popular science magazine. Many famous scientists, including Albert Einstein, have contributed articles in the past 170 years. It is the oldest continuously published monthly magazine in the United States.

skepticink.com.name: Skeptic Ink
skepticink.com.notes: Skeptic Ink is an independent outlet for scientific skepticism discourse. they are a diverse cast of writers, academics, philosophers, activists, and professionals writing on a broad range of topics but with concentrations in secularism and religion, philosophy, social justice, and social sciences. This source has low bias and high sourcing.

skeptic.com.name: Skeptic Magazine
skeptic.com.notes: Skeptic, colloquially known as Skeptic magazine, is a quarterly science education and science advocacy magazine published internationally by The Skeptics Society, a nonprofit organization devoted to promoting scientific skepticism and resisting the spread of pseudoscience, superstition, and irrational beliefs.

skepdic.com.name: The Skeptic’s Dictionary
skepdic.com.notes: The Skeptic’s Dictionary provides definitions, arguments, and essays on subjects such as the supernatural, occult, paranormal, and pseudoscientific.

csicop.org/si.name: Skeptical Inquirer
csicop.org/si.notes: Skeptical Inquirer is a bimonthly American magazine published by the Committee for Skeptical Inquiry (CSI) with the subtitle: The Magazine for Science and Reason.

skepticalscience.com.name: Skeptical Science
skepticalscience.com.notes: Skeptical Science is a climate science blog and information resource created in 2007 by Australian blogger and author John Cook. In addition to publishing articles on current events relating to climate science and climate policy, the site maintains a large database of articles analyzing the merit of arguments commonly put forth by those involved in the global warming controversy who oppose the mainstream scientific opinion on climate change (Wikipedia).  Strictly adheres to the scientific consensus on climate change and sources to credible scientific studies.

skeptoid.com.name: Skeptoid
skeptoid.com.notes: Skeptoid is a podcast and website run by Brian Dunning who also contributes to SkepticBlog. Skeptoid is a myth, urban myth, and pseudo-science debunking site. It is very thorough and fair in its assessments. They present the myth, etc, then follow up with the actual science or facts regarding the issue. (D. Kelley)

skyandtelescope.com.name: Sky and Telescope
skyandtelescope.com.notes: Sky & Telescope (S&T) is a monthly American magazine covering all aspects of amateur astronomy.

smithsonianmag.com.name: Smithsonian Magazine
smithsonianmag.com.notes: Smithsonian is the official journal published by the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C. The first issue was published in 1970.  Smithsonian magazine provides in-depth analysis of varied topics within a diverse range of scientific areas. (Wikipedia)

societyforscience.org.name: Society for Science
societyforscience.org.notes: Society for Science & the Public (SSP), formerly known as Science Service, is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization dedicated to the promotion of science, through its science education programs and publications, including the bi-weekly Science News magazine and the free-accessible online Science News for Students.

space.com.name: Space.com
space.com.notes: Space.com is a space and astronomy news website. Its stories are often syndicated to other media outlets.

techxplore.com.name: TechXplore
techxplore.com.notes: Tech Xplore, is a part of the Phys.org Network. It covers the latest in engineering, electronics, and tech.

watchers.news.name: The Watchers
watchers.news.notes: The Watchers (TW) is a hard science news site that covers a wide range of topics, from climate change to space exploration, with an emphasis on weather and related topics. The articles are well written, well sourced, and highly factual. TW exhibits no political bias in its reporting, simply reporting the facts and information as is, earning them a Pro-Science rating. (D. Kelley)

understandrealitythroughscience.blogspot.name: Understand Reality Through Science
understandrealitythroughscience.blogspot.notes: Understand Reality Through Science is the personal blog of Author Tom Rafferty, who wrote the book “Making Stuff Up is Unwise: An Introduction to Reason, Skepticism and Science.” The blog writes original content as well as curated and hand selected science news from a diverse range of scientific topics.  They specialize in debunking pseudoscience and myth.

ucsusa.org.name: Union of Concerned Scientists
ucsusa.org.notes: The Union of Concerned Scientists (UCS) is a nonprofit science advocacy organization based in the United States.  While the UCS is generally a good scientific source they do move slightly against the consensus on GMO, solar and a few other issues.  They have been criticized for having a political/financial bias.  Despite that, the good outweighs the bad with this source and we consider them Pro-Science.

webmd.com.name: WebMD
webmd.com.notes: WebMD is an American corporation known primarily as an online publisher of news and information pertaining to human health and well-being.  Although WebMD is typically scientifically sound it has been criticized for promoting drugs that are unnecessary by their pharmaceutical sponsors.

whatstheharm.net.name: What’s the Harm
whatstheharm.net.notes: A website that looks at pseudoscience and the damage it causes to both health and economy.

who.int/en.name: World Health Organization (WHO)
who.int/en.notes: The World Health Organization is a specialized agency of the United Nations that is concerned with international public health. It was established on 7 April 1948, headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland.  The World Health Organization has position papers on virtually every health issue and its opinion is the consensus of the medical experts around the world.

public.wmo.int.name: World Meteorological Organization
public.wmo.int.notes: The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) is an intergovernmental organization with a membership of 191 Member States and Territories. The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations. It is the UN system’s authoritative voice on the state and behavior of the Earth’s atmosphere, its interaction with the oceans, the climate it produces and the resulting distribution of water resources.

mediabiasfactcheck.com/conspiracy.name: Zero Hedge
mediabiasfactcheck.com/conspiracy.notes: Zero Hedge is a financial blog that aggregates news and presents editorial opinions from original and outside sources.  In between the aggregated news there are crazy economic conspiracies and general right wing biases.

educate-yourself.org.name: Educate Yourself
educate-yourself.org.notes: Focuses on alternative medicine and other pseudosciences.  Loves conspiracy theories as well.

truthandaction.org.name: Truth and Action
truthandaction.org.notes: Truth and Action is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. Uses loaded words frequently and often is not factual.

16wmpo.com.name: 16 WMPO
16wmpo.com.notes: A mostly satire site that looks like a local news network.

bizstandardnews.com.name: Business Standard News (BS News)
bizstandardnews.com.notes: From the BS News website: “The Business Standard News is a satirical site designed to parody the 24-hour news cycle. The stories are outlandish, but reality is so strange nowadays they could be true.”

encyclopediadramatica.se/Main_Page.name: Encyclopedia Dramatica
encyclopediadramatica.se/Main_Page.notes: Satire. Encyclopedia Dramatica is a satirical website, consisting of a wiki that uses MediaWiki software. Launched on December 10, 2004, it lampoons encyclopedia topics and current events, especially those related or relevant to contemporary Internet culture.

harddawn.com.name: Hard Dawn
harddawn.com.notes: Satire aimed at Trump and the right.

dandygoat.com.name: The Dandy Goat
dandygoat.com.notes: The Dandy Goat is a satirical news publication according to their disclaimer.

thehardtimes.net.name: The Hard Times
thehardtimes.net.notes: Satire. The Hard Times is a satire punk rock magazine.

theonion.com.name: The Onion
theonion.com.notes: Satire.  Perhaps the most famous satire site of all time.

outabouter.com.name: The Out and Abouter
outabouter.com.notes: From the Out and Abouter about page: “A boutique satirical website (which means I write these in an unheated shed in my backyard) with a focus on things inane, and Canadian.”

theseattletribune.com.name: The Seattle Tribune
theseattletribune.com.notes: From the Seattle Tribune disclaimer: “The Seattle Tribune is a news and entertainment satire web publication.”

thelastlineofdefense.org.name: The Resistance: The Last Line of Defense
thelastlineofdefense.org.notes: From their disclaimer: The Resistance may include information from sources that may or may not be reliable and facts that don’t necessarily exist. All articles should be considered satirical and any and all quotes attributed to actual people complete and total baloney. Pictures that represent actual people should be considered altered and not in any way real.

times.com.mx.name: The Times
times.com.mx.notes: Appears to be a combination of satire and some fake news.

undergroundnewsreport.com.name: The Underground Report
undergroundnewsreport.com.notes: Satire. From their disclaimer: Underground News Report is a news and political satire web publication, which may or may not use real names, often in semi-real or mostly fictitious ways. All news articles contained within Undergroundnewsreport.com are fiction, and presumably fake news.

truthbang.net.name: Truth Bang
truthbang.net.notes: According to the about page this is satire.

uspoln.com.name: USPOLN
uspoln.com.notes: According to their website, USPOLN is a US Political News and hybrid News/Satire platform on the web.

viraldevil.com.name: Viral Devil
viraldevil.com.notes: Viral Devil straddles the line between satire and fake news.

witscience.org.name: Wyoming Institute of Technology (WIT)
witscience.org.notes: Satire. Publishes fake science news that can be either humorous or deceptive.

100percentfedup.com.name: 100 Percent Fed Up
100percentfedup.com.notes: A news website and blog that has extreme right wing bias in reporting and does not source facts well.  Has a false claim via Politifact. Promotes right wing propaganda.

abcnews.com.co.name: AbcNews.com.co
abcnews.com.co.notes: Fake News site that looks like ABC News.

ageofshitlords.com.name: Age of Shitlords
ageofshitlords.com.notes: Age of Shitlords is a news and opinion website that is adamantly opposed to feminism. On the other hand it also writes many satire articles which generally makes this website confusing. We are listing it as questionable because it is difficult to tell what is real and what is meant to be satire.

allenwestrepublic.com.name: Allen West Republic
allenwestrepublic.com.notes: A website created by a fan of Allen West.  The website publishes information about Allen West and also highly biased right wing news stories. This source produces propaganda and has a poor track record with facts since it reports about Allen West.

allnewspipeline.com.name: All News Pipeline
allnewspipeline.com.notes: All News Pipeline (ANP) is a news and opinion blog that publishes news with an extreme right wing bias. The articles reviewed today from their news section reveal a severe distrust of mainstream media. In fact, most articles reference MSM as being fake news. This is ironic as ANP has false claims as indicated by Snopes.  ANP also has a category called Alternative News that publishes tin foil hat conspiracies. This source has it all, extreme right bias, propaganda, poorly sourced and heavy on conspiracy theories.

alternativemediasyndicate.com.name: Alternative Media Syndicate
alternativemediasyndicate.com.notes: The Alternative Media Syndicate is a news and opinion website/blog that has an extreme left wing bias. Presents information with moderate loaded words and sometimes links to questionable sources. Has a very strong liberal bias in story selection and does not have an “about” page. According to Snopes has published a false news story. They also have a Pants of Fire rating from Politifact.

acpeds.org.name: American College of Pediatricians
acpeds.org.notes: The American College of Pediatricians (ACPeds) is an advocacy group of pediatricians and other healthcare professionals in the United States. The group was founded in 2002 by a group of pediatricians, including Joseph Zanga, a past president of the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP), as a protest against the AAP’s support for adoption by gay couples. The group’s membership as of 2016 is estimated at 500 members, in contrast to the AAP’s over 60,000 members. The organization’s view on parenting is at odds with the position of the American Academy of Pediatrics, which holds that sexual orientation has no correlation with the ability to be a good parent and to raise healthy and well-adjusted children. The American College of Pediatricians has been described by the Southern Poverty Law Center as a “hate group“, with “a history of propagating damaging falsehoods about LGBT people”.

americanpatriotdaily.com.name: American Patriot Daily
americanpatriotdaily.com.notes: American Patriot Daily is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. All stories use loaded words that favor conservatives and denigrate liberals. They consistently only present one side of the story, which misrepresents facts. This is a classic propaganda tactic that uses just enough facts to make a case, without providing a counter point to give full context. The American Daily Patriot does tend to source their articles, however our review shows that they mostly use right wing sources such as Breitbart and Daily Caller, both of which have made false claims according to fact checkers.

afa.net.name: American Family Association
afa.net.notes: The American Family Association (AFA) is a non-profit organization based in the United States that promotes fundamentalist Christian values. It opposes same-sex marriage, pornography, and abortion. The AFA is considers an anti-LGBT hate group by the Southern Poverty Law Center. Not well sourced.

americasfreedomfighters.com.name: Americas Freedom Fighters
americasfreedomfighters.com.notes: America’s Freedom Fighters is a news and opinion website that has over the top right wing bias.  Routinely publishes conspiracy theories and is factually void.

americanlookout.com.name: American Lookout
americanlookout.com.notes: American Lookout is a conservative news and opinion site.  Has a very strong to extreme right wing bias and does not source to credible information. Considers credible news sources to be fake news. Promotes propaganda.

americannews.com.name: American News
americannews.com.notes: American News is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion site.  Poorly sourced with minimal basis in facts.

amren.com.name: American Renaissance Magazine
amren.com.notes: American Renaissance (AR or AmRen) is a monthly online magazine published by the New Century Foundation which describes itself as a “race-realist, white advocacy organization”. It has been described as a white supremacist publication by several sources, including The Washington Post, Fortune, and the Anti-Defamation League.  According to the Southern Poverty Law Center “AR is a self-styled think tank that promotes pseudo-scientific studies and research that purport to show the inferiority of blacks to whites — although in language that avoids open racial slurs and attempts to portray itself as serious scholarship.”

americantoday.news.name: American Today
americantoday.news.notes: American Today is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. Every headline and article contains loaded emotional words that favor conservatives and discredits liberals. Further, 90% of the articles reviewed were pro-Trump propaganda, that though linked to evidence, did not present the other side of the story from a different perspective. American Today is also listed as an Untrustworthy website by Fake News Checker.

americanupdater.com.name: American Updater
americanupdater.com.notes: American Updater is a news and opinion website with extreme right bias.  Publishes common right wing conspiracies such as claiming President Obama is the Anti-Christ. Many stories are simply fake news.

aattp.org.name: Americans Against the Tea Party (AATTP)
aattp.org.notes: Americans Against the Tea Party is a news and opinion website that was created in response to the rise of the Tea Party. Their mission is to dispel the falsehoods and myths spread by conservatives. Unfortunately, they produce content that is highly sensationalized and poorly sourced. AATTP is the far left’s response to right wing propaganda and it is equally as bad. It appears AATTP stopped publishing in July 2016.

avoiceformen.com.name: A Voice for Men
avoiceformen.com.notes: A Voice for Men (AVFM) is a men’s human right advocacy site run by Paul Elam, the titular leader of the men’s rights movement in America. AVFM is not so much a news source as an extended blog and echo chamber consisting primarily of op-ed style content decrying the feminist movement and touting what Mr. Elam and other contributors see as the persecution of males in a female run society. There is very little external sourcing for any of the content, and what source links I did follow led only to other anti-feminism opinion pieces and sites. The content is heavily weighted against feminism, and much of it revolves around the usual men’s rights issues. Divorce, custody, child support, men’s reproductive rights, etc. The site earns a Questionable rating based on the extreme bias of its men’s rights advocacy. (D. Kelley)

barenakedislam.com.name: Bare Naked Islam
barenakedislam.com.notes: Bare Naked Islam is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. This source promotes extreme Islamophobia and is classified as an Anti-Islam hate group by the Southern Poverty Law Center.  Further, this source has a poor record with fact checking. This is a very unreliable hate group.

bb4sp.com.name: BB4SP
bb4sp.com.notes: BB4SP is an online news and opinion source.  The site consists of extreme right wing news, some conspiracy and uses racial terms such as “Thug” to describe African Americans. This source does not source information well.

beforeitsnews.com.name: Before it’s News
beforeitsnews.com.notes: Before It’s News is a citizens journalism website where stories are provided by individuals without credentials.  Stories can range from moderately credible to tin-foil hat conspiracies. It seems this source has become a haven for conspiracy theorists and pseudo-scientists. Further, the website is riddled with pop-up ads and potential malware that make it impossible and unsafe to navigate. This source has been classified as Fake News by Fake News Watch.

bigbluevision.org.name: Big Blue Vision
bigbluevision.org.notes: Big Blue Vision is an extreme right biased news source.  They do not shy from conspiracies and virtually everything they report has factual issues due to lack of credible sources.

bipartisanreport.com.name: Bipartisan Report
bipartisanreport.com.notes: The Bipartisan Report is a news and opinion website with  a very clear and extreme liberal bias.  The BP uses strong loaded language in both sensational headlines and also the body of articles. BP has published articles containing pseudoscience and conspiracies.  They also have a poor track record with fact checkers here and here. BP is a liberal propaganda website that requires fact checking.

blackgenocide.org/home.html.name: Black Genocide
blackgenocide.org/home.html.notes: Black Genocide is a radical anti-abortion website that promotes the idea that Black’s have been targeted to have abortions.  This site relies on very old debunked conspiracies and consistently fails in fact checking.

cbsnews.com.co.name: CBSNews.com.co
cbsnews.com.co.notes: A fake news website that looks like CBS News.

censored.news.name: Censored.News
censored.news.notes: Censored.News aggregates news from a variety of sources. Virtually every one of them is either Questionable, Conspiracy, Pseudoscience by our standards and all have a right wing bias. For example, they have an entire newsfeed dedicated to Natural News and well known purveyor of right wing conspiracies and pseudoscience.

cis.org.name: Center for Immigration Studies (CIS)
cis.org.notes: The Center for Immigration Studies (CIS) is a non-profit research organization “that favors far lower immigration numbers and produces research to further those views.” It was started as a spin-off from John Tanton’s Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR) in 1985. Reports published by the CIS have been widely deemed misleading and riddled with basic errors by scholars on immigration; think tanks from across the ideological and political spectrum; media of all stripes; several leading nonpartisan immigration-research organizations; and by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. The organization has also drawn criticism for its financial and intellectual ties to extremist racists. The Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC) published reports in 2002 and 2009 connecting CIS to John Tanton, who helped found various other organizations, including the Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR) and NumbersUSA, and showing he has ties to white supremacy groups and a eugenics foundation (SPLC). Bottom line, this is a hate group.

cityworldnews.com.name: CityWorldNews
cityworldnews.com.notes: CityWorldNews is a fake news and opinion website. According to Snopes “CityWorldNews is a fake news web site that does not publish factual stories: the front page of the site currently lists hoax stories about Jeb Bush’s entering a mental hospital, a fake Donald Trump tweet, and a woman’s desire to raise her youngest daughter as a stripper.”

clarionproject.org.name: Clarion Project
clarionproject.org.notes: The Clarion Project (formerly Clarion Fund Inc.) is a Washington, D.C.-based non-profit organization founded in 2006. The Clarion Project states its mission as “exposing the dangers of Islamic extremism while providing a platform for the voices of moderation and promoting grassroots activism.” The Clarion Project has an extreme right wing bias in reporting and wording. They are classified as an active anti-Muslim hate group by the Southern Poverty Law Center. Has a false claim according to a fact checker.

clashdaily.com.name: Clash Daily
clashdaily.com.notes: Clash Daily is a website founded by Doug Giles, an extreme christian right pastor.  The content of the website is extreme right wing that often is not factual, unscientific and biased.  It demonstrates opposition toward LGBT people, atheists and Muslims through wording and political affiliation.

cnn.com.de.name: Cnn.com.de
cnn.com.de.notes: Fake News website that looks similar to CNN.

conservativedailypost.com.name: Conservative Daily Post
conservativedailypost.com.notes: The Conservative Daily Post is a news and opinion website that is hard to determine if it is satire or real.  If it is real then it is off the charts with right wing propaganda and conspiracy. Others have classified this website as fake news. Has a poor record with both Snopes and Politifact.

conservativefighters.com.name: Conservative Fighters
conservativefighters.com.notes: Conservative Fighters is a news and opinion website that does not source to credible sources, if at all.  The bias is extreme right and uses questionable language regarding race. For every credible article there seems to be two that are conspiracy or propaganda.

conservativeinfocorner.us.name: Conservative Info Corner
conservativeinfocorner.us.notes: Conservative Info Corner is a news and opinion website that has extreme right wing bias and often publishes fake news. For example, they have an article claiming that Malia Obama was expelled from Harvard due to drug use. According to Snopes this is False. In another story there is a headline that reads “Barack Obama Resurfaces to make Terrifying Announcement this isn’t good.” This misleading/sensational headline then takes you to a story about how Obama is going to speak in Ireland. That is it. Nothing terrifying. This is a fake news source.

conservapedia.com/Main_Page.name: Conservapedia
conservapedia.com/Main_Page.notes: Conservapedia is an English-language wiki encyclopedia project written from an American conservative, Young Earth creationist, and Christian fundamentalist point of view. This website is not credible for science information and a lot of reports are simply false.

conservative101.com.name: Conservative 101
conservative101.com.notes: Conservative 101 is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias.  This source routinely publishes conspiracy theories and has been accused of publishing fake news.  This source could easily be listed in our Conspiracy category, but because of its one sided right wing bias we will place it here.  This website has zero credibility as a news source.

conservativepost.com.name: Conservative Post
conservativepost.com.notes: The Conservative Post is a news and opinion website with Extreme right wing/conservative bias in content and wording.  Content is sometimes so over the top it is difficult to tell if it is serious or satire. Articles contain questionable language regarding race and many are not factual.

conservativespirit.com.name: Conservative Spirit
conservativespirit.com.notes: Conservative Spirit is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website.  A lot of information is factually inaccurate and they publish conspiracies such as the Clinton’s murdering people.  Total nonsense.

conservativetribune.com.name: Conservative Tribune
conservativetribune.com.notes: The Conservative Tribune displays blatant right wing/conservative bias.  Consistently fails fact checks, glorifies violence against African Americans and Muslims and promotes right wing conspiracies.

rickwells.us.name: Constitution Rising
rickwells.us.notes: This is essentially a right wing blog with  very strong conservative bias in reporting.  Constitution Rising often makes conspiratorial claims without evidence such as this: Syria Attack – ISIS False Flag To Give Establishment Their War With Assad, Russia. This source could easily be listed in our Conspiracy/Pseudoscience category, but do to the extreme right bias we rate it as questionable.

conservative-headlines.com.name: Council of Concerned Citizens
conservative-headlines.com.notes: The Council of Conservative Citizens (CofCC) is an American far-right organization that supports a large variety of conservative and paleoconservative causes in addition to white nationalism and white separatism. Its Statement of Principles says that they “oppose all efforts to mix the races of mankind”. Several members of the CofCC Board of Directors are former leaders of the segregationist Citizens’ Councils of America. According to the Southern Poverty Law Center this is a White Supremacist hate group.

dailybuzzlive.com.name: Daily Buzz Live
dailybuzzlive.com.notes: They don’t have an about page so we can’t determine if this is meant to be satire or not. We will just call it Fake News.

dailyheadlines.net.name: Daily Headlines
dailyheadlines.net.notes: Daily Headlines is an overtly right wing biased propaganda website.  Many articles are not related to politics, but the ones that are certainly favor the right and discredit the left. While they do attempt to provide sources in their articles many just lead straight to other right wing media. We also rate sources questionable that consider credible media sources such as the New York Times, Wall Street Journal and CNN as fake news, which is exactly what Daily Headlines does. They also publish fake news stories, albeit funny, such as this: DNC Propaganda Site USA Today Posts Disgraceful Photo Shop Photo

dailyinfobox.com.name: Daily Infobox
dailyinfobox.com.notes: Daily Infobox is an extreme right news and opinion website. Since there isn’t an about page claiming this is satire, we are assuming this is simply a fake news site. Contains ridiculous stories that have been refuted over and over. Total nonsense clickbait!

dailystormer.com.name: Daily Stormer
dailystormer.com.notes: The Daily Stormer is an American neo-Nazi and white supremacist news and commentary website. It is part of the alt-right movement. Its editor is Andrew Anglin, who founded it on July 4, 2013, as a faster-paced replacement for his previous website Total Fascism. According to the Southern Poverty Law Center this is a Neo-Nazi Hate group. This source is not worthy of a click.

dangerandplay.com.name: Danger and Play
dangerandplay.com.notes: Danger and Play is the blog/website for Mike Cernovich, an American social media personality and author. He is usually described as part of the alt-right, however he describes himself as “new right.” Cernovich is known for promoting false or unproven stories such as the claim that Hilary Clinton has Parkinson’s Disease and most recently the debunked Pizzagate scandal. Clinton having Parkinson’s has been debunked here and here. Pizzagate has been debunked here and here. Danger and Play also has an extreme right bias in it’s promotion of conservatives and vilification of liberals as seen in both the Parkinson’s and Pizzagate conspiracies. Further, Mr. Cernovich has also landed a Pants on Fire rating from Politifact for his claim that Cleveland police are not ‘standing down’ during RNC. Overall, this source has an extreme right wing bias in reporting, promotes propaganda/conspiracy and should be viewed as highly questionable for accurate information.

horowitzfreedomcenter.org.name: David Horowitz Freedom Center
horowitzfreedomcenter.org.notes: The David Horowitz Freedom Center, formerly the Center for the Study of Popular Culture (CSPC), is a conservative foundation founded in 1988 by political activist David Horowitz. David Horowitz is known as the Grandfather of Islamophobia according to the Southern Poverty Law Center. Horowitz also has a very poor track record with facts. This is a propaganda site that promotes hate.

democraticreview.com.name: Democratic Review
democraticreview.com.notes: Democratic Review is a news and opinion website with an extreme left wing bias. This source is considered questionable due to overly sensationalized headlines that contain loaded words such as: “BREAKING: Lawyers Reveal New Evidence About Trump Pedophile Case, You’ll Puke!” Further, most articles source to other extreme left biased media, which is often lacking in evidence for claims. In a nutshell, this a propaganda website.

denverguardian.com.name: Denver Guardian
denverguardian.com.notes: Fake News. The Denver Guardian posted one fake article that made its rounds in social media.  Interestingly, the Denver Guardian does not exist.  According to a Denver Post article they simply do not exist.

maganews.co.name: Departed (Maganews.com)
maganews.co.notes: Departed is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website. All headlines are sensationalized and lead to mostly fake or misleading content. This source has been rated as fake news by Politifact. This means that Politifact has caught this source publishing at least one fake news article. We also recommend that you do not click on the website link below as the website attempts to hijack your browser.

thedcgazette.com.name: DC Gazette
thedcgazette.com.notes: The DC Gazette churns out propaganda and conspiracy.  Some of the news is fake and some is credible, but all of it has a very strong right wing bias. According to Snopes the “DC Gazette is a clickbait web site that, among other things, posts fake news items as if they were real news.”

discoverthenetworks.org.name: Discover the Networks
discoverthenetworks.org.notes: Discover the Networks (originally Discover the Network) is a website run by the David Horowitz Freedom Center that focuses on the individuals, groups, and history of groups alleged to be political left wing.  The David Horowitz Freedom Center is also labelled as an anti-Islamist propaganda source by the Southern Poverty Law Center.

donaldtrumpnews.co.name: Donald Trump News
donaldtrumpnews.co.notes: Fake News (propaganda, disinformation, conspiracy) stories with an extreme right wing bias.

downtrend.com.name: Downtrend
downtrend.com.notes: An extreme right-wing online news source.  The content generally consists of right-wing political conspiracy theories and does not rely on evidence.  Some articles seem to be satire or perhaps it really is that extreme.  Has questionable content regarding race.

drainingtheswamp.info.name: Draining the Swamp
drainingtheswamp.info.notes: According to their about page: “With the Donald Trump winning the presidency, a new political era has been ushered in. This is the dawn of a new day. Welcome to the DeplorablesNetwork.com where we continue our fight against Communism and radical Islam.” Draining the swamp tends to fight against most everything non-white or non-conservative. Some stories are sourced to credible information. We rate this source questionable based on extreme bias.

eaglerising.com.name: Eagle Rising
eaglerising.com.notes: Eagle Rising is an extreme right wing biased news website.  Most information is sourced to other right wing or questionable sources and there are numerous conspiracy theories espoused. Eagle rising has been cited as fake news by other sources.

embols.com.name: Embols
embols.com.notes: Embols recently wound up on a list by an Assistant Professor of Communications and Media.  However, this list has been widely circulated and criticized for liberal bias. Embols is a news reporting site that takes information from other sources and repackages it.  In reviewing this site we found one article that sourced a fake story from a conspiracy site.  Most others were just poorly sourced.

endingthefed.com.name: Ending the Fed News
endingthefed.com.notes: Ending the Fed is an extreme right wing biased conspiracy website. There is little sourced information with most articles consisting of propaganda or outright fake news.

en-volve.com.name: En Volve
en-volve.com.notes: En Volve is an extreme right biased news and opinion website. En-Volve has also published ridiculous stories such as “Obama Orders Life-Sized Bronze Statue of Himself to Be Permanently Installed in White House?” and this “Colin Kaepernick FIRED From 49ers After Disrespecting Police and National Anthem,” which obviously is not true as he played the entire season with them after this fake news article was published. Since, En-Volve does not have an about page stating they are satire, we must assume they are just a propaganda site that publishes fake news.

frc.org.name: Family Research Council
frc.org.notes: The Family Research Council (FRC) is an American conservative Christian group and lobbying organization formed in the United States in 1981 by James Dobson.  Tony Perkins is its current president.  The FRC promotes traditional family values, by advocating and lobbying for socially conservative policies. It opposes and lobbies against LGBT rights, abortion, divorce, embryonic stem-cell research and pornography.  In 2010, the Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC) classified the FRC as an anti-gay hate group.

federalisttribune.com.name: Federalist Tribune
federalisttribune.com.notes: The Federalist Tribune is a news and opinion blog/website with an extreme right wing bias. FT uses emotional language that favors conservatives and discredits liberals. They only report one side of the story and often use sources that are located on our “Questionable” list. While this source does publish some valid news, it is blurred by extreme bias and propaganda.

focusonthefamily.com.name: Focus on the Family
focusonthefamily.com.notes: Focus on the Family is an American Christian conservative organization founded in 1977 by psychologist James Dobson, based in Colorado Springs, Colorado. It is active in promoting an interdenominational effort toward its socially conservative views on public policy. Has a very extreme right wing bias in reporting. Often makes false claims about the LGBTQ community.

freakoutnation.com.name: Freakout Nation
freakoutnation.com.notes: Freakout Nation is a web based publication with an overt left wing bias.  Does not always have reliable information that is backed up with sources. Sometimes delves into conspiracies and promotes propaganda. Listed as a fake news source by others.

freedomdaily.com.name: Freedom Daily
freedomdaily.com.notes: Freedom Daily is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion site.  Uses inflammatory language to describe liberals, minorities and Muslims.  Often does not source to credible information.

freedomlibertynews.com.name: Freedom Liberty News
freedomlibertynews.com.notes: Freedom Liberty News is a news and opinion website that publishes extreme right propaganda and disinformation. This source uses offensive language regarding race and is anti-muslim.

freedomoutpost.com.name: Freedom Outpost
freedomoutpost.com.notes: Freedom Outpost is an extreme right wing news website.  It is ironic that it has the name freedom in its title because most of the content appears to be about denying freedom for non-Christians.  The site is filled with right wing conspiracies, propaganda and contains questionable language when talking about African Americans.

freedomsfinalstand.com.name: Freedom’s Final Stand
freedomsfinalstand.com.notes: Freedom’s Final Stand is an extreme right biased news and opinion website. Most information on this website is sourced to other questionable or far right sources. This is a classic propaganda website.

theusa-news.com.name: Fresh News – USA
theusa-news.com.notes: Fresh News – USA is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. Virtually every article on the website is pro-right wing. Fresh News uses biased loaded words and seems to have a tremendous preoccupation (fear) with Islam. In fact, most articles on the site are anti-Islam propaganda. They also seem to be opposed to other immigrants as well. In short, this is a propaganda site.

frontpagemag.com.name: Frontpage Magazine
frontpagemag.com.notes: FrontPage Magazine is an online conservative political website, edited by David Horowitz and published by the David Horowitz Freedom Center, a non-profit organization in Los Angeles, California.  This source has a pretty strong right wing bias in reporting that often is negative toward minorities and Islam. Frontpage Magazine is also listed on the Islamophobia Network. The Southern Poverty Law Center has this magazine labeled as an anti-Muslim.

fury.news.name: Fury News
fury.news.notes: Fury News is an extreme right wing news and opinion site.  This source is very “furious” with liberals, African Americans, Muslims and the poor.  Consistently refers to blacks and Black Lives Matter as “thugs” and either intentionally or not, publish fake news from other overtly right wing propaganda sites.  This source ranks as one of the worst we have rated.

globalinfotoday.com.name: Global Info Today
globalinfotoday.com.notes: Global Info Today is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. Uses loaded words, promotes propaganda and does not source to credible information.

goneleft.com.name: Gone Left
goneleft.com.notes: Gone Left is a news website/blog that has an extreme left wing bias.  This source does not shy away from conspiracy theories and promotes left wing propaganda.  This site is also lacking an about page and therefore lacks credibility.

goodgopher.com.name: GoodGopher
goodgopher.com.notes: GoodGopher is not actually a news source, but rather a search engine that only searches specific sources. GoodGopher was created by Mike Adams the founder of the Conspiracy-Pseudoscience website Natural News. Virtually every source they search is either a conspiracy, pseudoscience, questionable or right biased website. Basically, this search engine is geared toward people who want to filter out reality.

hangthebankers.com.name: Hang the Bankers
hangthebankers.com.notes: A news and opinion website that has extreme right wing bias in reporting and does not source facts well.  Promotes propaganda.

ifyouonlynews.com.name: If You Only News
ifyouonlynews.com.notes: If You Only News is a news and opinion site that has a far left bias.  Many stories seem to blur the line between satire and actual news.  While some of their stories are factual many are propaganda and flat out fake news stories.

ihavethetruth.com.name: I have the Truth
ihavethetruth.com.notes: I have the Truth is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website.  Contains propaganda and displays questionable language by referring to Black Lives Matters as thugs..

ilovemyfreedom.org.name: I Love My Freedom
ilovemyfreedom.org.notes: I Love My Freedom is a news and opinion website.  After a few moments on this website you will see that the only freedom loved here is for White Christian Males.  This source is extremely anti-islam and promotes conspiracy theories.

itaglive.com.name: iTag Live
itaglive.com.notes: A mix of Satire and Fake News

informationliberation.com.name: Information Liberation
informationliberation.com.notes: Information Liberation is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. Virtually every article reports positively for conservative causes and negatively for liberals. Information Liberation uses loaded words to convey either positive or negative emotions. While Information Liberation does publish credible news that is sourced properly, it also publishes news that is sourced to right wing biased, conspiracy and questionable sources. They also perform misleading fact checks such as this one: FACT CHECK: Hillary Said 90% of Clinton Foundation Donations go to Charity. Actual Number? 5.7%. This fact check simply is not true. Either this is a very poorly done fact check or they were intentionally trying to mislead. The actual number that goes to charity is 89%. The deception in this fact check is in the wording. 5.7% of donation go to outside charity groups, this much is true. With this fact check Information Liberation is misleading people to believe that only 5.7% goes to actual charity when in fact it is closer to 90%. See the full and proper fact check here. Due to extreme bias and intentionally being misleading we rate this source as Questionable.

informedowners.com.name: Informed Owners
informedowners.com.notes: Informed Owners is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion site.  There is little proper sourcing done and many stories would be classified as conspiracies or propaganda. Not credible as a news source.

israelvideonetwork.com.name: Israel Video Network
israelvideonetwork.com.notes: The Israel Video Network is a right wing pro-Israel and anti-Islam news network. As the name implies they publish video news. The content is extremely against Palestine and against liberalism in general. They use strong loaded wording in headlines and publish propaganda.

jewwatch.com.name: Jew Watch
jewwatch.com.notes: Jew Watch is an antisemitic website that promotes Holocaust denial and various negative claims about Jews. The claims include allegations of a conspiracy that Jews control the media and banking industries, as well as accusations of Jewish involvement in terrorist groups. Quite simply this is a hate group.

jihadwatch.org.name: Jihad Watch
jihadwatch.org.notes: Jihad Watch is a blog affiliated with the David Horowitz Freedom Center, run by blogger Robert Spencer, it has been described as one of the main homes of the anti-Islamic Counter-jihad movement on the internet.  It has been repeatedly criticized by numerous academics who believe that it promotes an Islamophobic worldview and conspiracy theories.

jookos.com.name: Jookos News
jookos.com.notes: Jookos News is a right wing conservative biased site with loaded words and content. Not very factual and does not shy from conspiracy theories.

ladylibertysnews.com.name: Lady Liberty News
ladylibertysnews.com.notes: Lady Liberty News is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. Most articles are either poorly sourced or linked to other questionable/conspiracy sources. LLN also promotes Islamophobia and uses questionable language when describing African Americans. This is not a credible source for evidence based information.

learnprogress.org.name: Learn Progress
learnprogress.org.notes: Learn Progress is a news and opinion website with an extreme left wing bias.  The website consists of articles with misleading headlines, loaded words and outrageous claims without sources.  Needs fact checking.

liberalplug.com.name: Liberal Plug
liberalplug.com.notes: The Liberal Plug is a news and opinion website with extreme left wing bias. Some stories appear to be outright fake news. Most others are not properly sourced and amount to left wing propaganda. This source is not credible.

liberalsociety.com.name: Liberal Society
liberalsociety.com.notes: Liberal Society is an extreme left news and opinion website. Liberal Society does not source to credible information and promotes left wing propaganda.

libertybrief.com.name: Liberty Brief
libertybrief.com.notes: Liberty Brief is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right bias in reporting. Virtually every article is either against Obama or Clinton. It also is highly pro-Trump. Unfortunately, virtually every article on the front page is straight from the propaganda playbook. There is just enough facts for the author to make outrageous assertions that are highly misleading. In one such article the author is very upset that the Obama’s have signed a deal with a speaking agency. In her words: “the Obamas have now figured out a brand new way to con our country and rake in millions while sitting on their lazy asses.” One has to wonder what the author is implying when referring to the Obama’s as lazy?

liberty-courier.com.name: Liberty Courier
liberty-courier.com.notes: The Liberty Courier is an extreme right wing news and opinion website. Every single article has a sensational headline that usually isn’t true. A simple fact check on just the headlines will reveal that most stories are either false, taken out of context or misleading. This source is somewhere between overt propaganda and fake news. Here is a Pants on Fire fact check from Politifact, regarding Vince Foster’s death being ruled a homicide.

libertyisviral.com.name: Liberty is Viral
libertyisviral.com.notes: Liberty is Viral is an extreme right biased news and opinion website. Most information on this website is sourced to other questionable or far right sources. This is a classic propaganda website.

libertywritersnews.com.name: Liberty Writers News
libertywritersnews.com.notes: Liberty Writers News is a highly biased extreme right wing website that re-posts news from other sources.  Has been accused and admitted to publishing fake news stories. Simply not credible as a news source.

loonwatch.com.name: LoonWatch
loonwatch.com.notes: According to LoonWatch’s about page they are a blogzine run by a motley group of hate-allergic bloggers to monitor and expose the web’s plethora of anti-Muslim loons, wackos, and conspiracy theorists. While Media Bias Fact Check rates Islamophobic websites as questionable, we must also rate a site that demonizes any criticism of Islam, even radical Islam as being equally questionable. We admire this website for tackling the true prejudices and crimes against Muslims, but they even go so far as to attack an atheist comedian. This is a propaganda site.

madworldnews.com.name: Mad World News
madworldnews.com.notes: Mad World News is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website.  This source routinely misrepresents facts and is simply not a credible source.

mediazone.news.name: Media Zone
mediazone.news.notes: Media Zone is a news and opinion website with extreme right wing bias in reporting. This source also does not shy away from fake news, conspiracies and propaganda.

en.metapedia.org/wiki/Main_Page.name: Metapedia
en.metapedia.org/wiki/Main_Page.notes: Metapedia is an electronic encyclopedia which contains far-right, white nationalist, white supremacist, white separatist, antisemitic, Holocaust denial and neo-Nazi points of view. This source is not credible.

milo.yiannopoulos.net.name: MILO News
milo.yiannopoulos.net.notes: Milo Yiannopoulos is a British media personality associated with the political alt-right and a former senior editor for Breitbart News. Describing himself as a “cultural libertarian,” he is a vocal critic of feminism, Islam, social justice, political correctness, and other movements and ideologies he sees as authoritarian or left wing. MILO News publishes right wing biased news with the use of loaded words and sensational headlines. MILO is not a fake news site as they publish mostly real news, however it is on the extreme end of right wing. Milo Yiannopoulos has made some false and outrageous statements that have both made him popular with some segments and loathed by others. We rate this source questionable based on extreme bias and outrageous statements made by the author. We recommend following this Link to Rationalwiki for a detailed list of his false claims and controversies.

molonlabemedia.com.name: Molon Labe Media
molonlabemedia.com.notes: Molon Labe Media has extreme far right bias that is over the top.  They consistently publish right wing conspiracy theories that can easily be mistaken for satire.  Sadly, the content  of this site is not satire! It appears to be unintentional or intentional fake news.

movingleft.com.name: Moving Left
movingleft.com.notes: Moving Left is a news and opinion blog with an extreme left wing bias. Moving left uses strong loaded words in both sensational headlines and in articles. The sources for articles is typically from far left sources or questionable sources such as Truth Examiner. We rate Moving Left questionable based on poor sourcing and extreme bias.

mrcblog.com.name: Mr. Conservative (MRC)
mrcblog.com.notes: Mr. Conservative is an extreme right wing news blog that has been flagged for posting false information. All headlines contain loaded words and many use questionable language when talking about race. This source is simply unreliable for credible information.

myzonetoday.com.name: MyZoneToday
myzonetoday.com.notes: MyZoneToday is a far right biased news website/blog.  This source sometimes publishes conspiracy theories and is not factual in other cases. Some news is just fake.

nationonenews.com.name: Nation One News
nationonenews.com.notes: Nation One News is a news and opinion website that has an extreme right wing bias in reporting. Most articles contain loaded sensationalized headlines and have minimal to poor sourcing in the body of the articles. For example, they source Infowars in one article, which is a very popular conspiracy website. In another article, they make claims that a fact checker is funded by George Soros and Hillary Clinton sympathizers, without providing evidence such as a link or name of their source. This is not only dishonest, it can be classified as libel (a published false statement that is damaging to a person’s reputation; a written defamation.) Further, in this same article they claim the fact checker is run by Khoop-Consortium, which is supposedly a “left-wing anarchist group.” Our research reveals that this group does not exist on the web. We are not claiming they do not exist at all, just that we cannot find them. The author then goes on to claim he is filing a lawsuit against this fact checker, which is surprising since the author is defaming the fact checker in his own article. Nation One News primarily publishes pro-right and anti-left news information, without presenting both sides of the story. In other words, this source primarily produces pro-right propaganda (information, especially of a biased or misleading nature, used to promote a political cause or point of view). This source is also listed on the Fake News Codex as well as another list that classifies it as being a Fake-Conspiracy website. Our review “does not conclude” that this is a fake news website, but rather just an extremely biased one that uses questionable sourcing techniques.

nationaleconomicseditorial.com.name: National Economics Editorial
nationaleconomicseditorial.com.notes: National Economics Editorial (NEE) is a news site that purports to support Economic Nationalism. While NEE does cover some economic issues it is, as the name implies, mainly an editorial site. The opinions expressed in the stories cover current affairs with a pronounced right wing bias. NEE is, on the whole, long on rhetoric and short on factual content and credible sourcing. Due to the overt bias and lack of factual information, NEE is rated Questionable. (D. Kelley)

npiamerica.org.name: National Policy Institute
npiamerica.org.notes: The National Policy Institute (NPI) is an alt right, white nationalist, and white supremacist think tank based in Arlington, Virginia. This is a hate group according to the Southern Poverty Law Center.

nevo.news.name: Nevo News
nevo.news.notes: Nevo News has extreme right wing bias with sensational stories that are generally unproven conspiracies.  Not trustworthy for factual news.

newcenturytimes.com.name: New Century Times
newcenturytimes.com.notes: New Century Times also known as NCT is an online news website that publishes news with an extreme left wing bias.  This source also does not source all articles and many stories are not factual. Promotes left wing propaganda.

newnation.org.name: New Nation News
newnation.org.notes: New Nation News sole purpose is to post news about black on white crime. The mission of this website is to show that blacks are dangerous and a threat to whites. This is one of the most overtly racist websites I have reviewed. I provide a link below, but I caution against clicking on it. This website is nauseating.

newpoliticstoday.com.name: New Politics Today
newpoliticstoday.com.notes: New Politics Today is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing and anti-Muslim bias. Out of 10 articles reviewed, 8 were portraying Muslims negatively. New Politics Today also rarely sources to credible media outlets, instead using conspiracy sites and questionable sources to support their stories. Rather than being a fake news source this is simply a propaganda site for the extreme Alt-right.

newsbreakshere.com.name: NewsBreaksHere
newsbreakshere.com.notes: NewsBreaksHere is an extreme right biased news and opinion website. Virtually every story on this source is questionable and often links to other questionable and/or highly biased news sources. NewsBreaksHere also has a website that is difficult to navigate due to obnoxious pop-up advertising that tries to redirect you to potentially unsafe websites.

newschicken.com.name: News Chicken
newschicken.com.notes: News Chicken does not have an “about” page or “disclaimer” so it not possible to know the owners intent. Most articles contains videos that portray Muslims and immigrants in a negative light. News Chicken has a strong right wing bias in reporting through story choices and loaded words. According to Real or Satire this source is listed as Satire. In reviewing this site we found real news posted, but with an extreme bias. Some stories do appear to be fake or originate from satire websites, but because there isn’t a statement indicating this website is satire we are classifying it as Questionable, based on extreme right wing bias and negative portrayal of immigrants.

newswithviews.com.name: News With Views
newswithviews.com.notes: News With Views has the tagline “Where reality shatters illusion.”  The irony of this is not lost as this is a strongly right wing news and opinion site that is not shy about conspiracy theories. There is more illusion than reality found here.

noscomunicamos.com.name: Nos Comunicamos
noscomunicamos.com.notes: Nos Comunicamos claims to be a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy.  However, the content of its news stories consist of extreme right wing bias, Islamophobia, and tired conspiracy theories.

occupydemocrats.com.name: Occupy Democrats
occupydemocrats.com.notes: Occupy Democrats is a political and news organization with an extreme left wing bias in reporting and story choices.  Has a dismal fact check record according to Politifact.  See also Snopes. Always fact check this source! Promotes left-wing propaganda without regard to sourcing.

onlineconservativepress.com.name: Online Conservative Press
onlineconservativepress.com.notes: Extreme conservative right wing bias and numerous conspiracy theories that are not based on evidence. Promotes right wing based propaganda.

oppositionreport.com.name: Opposition Report
oppositionreport.com.notes: Opposition Report is a far left news and opinion website. Opposition Report uses sensational headlines with loaded words. The articles also contain loaded emotional words that are against conservatives and pro-liberal. Opposition Report does source their information, but many times it is to far left or questionable sources. Based on this we rate them questionable based extreme left wing bias and propaganda promotion.

oureyeonislam.com.name: Our Eye on Islam
oureyeonislam.com.notes: Our Eye On Islam (OEOI) is an extreme right wing anti Islamic site packaging conspiracies and wildly distorted facts as “news”. There are no source links for their stories, and no byline credit for the authors except OEOI itself. There is no pretense of impartiality on OEOI, and their stories are really just a collection of the rehashed, heavily biased rhetoric, intentionally misleading and  misinterpreted “facts”, and outright fake news you typically find touted as “truth” on this type of site.

overpassesforamerica.com.name: Overpasses for America
overpassesforamerica.com.notes: Overpasses for America is not a website about infrastructure. It is an extreme right wing news and opinion website. OFA is not well sourced to factual content and uses sensational headlines. In other words it is a low quality propaganda website.

patriotfires.com.name: Patriot Fires
patriotfires.com.notes: Patriotfires.com is an extreme right bias news and opinion website. There is very little factual information and all headlines are sensationalized. For example, there is article claiming that Michelle Obama attempted to register to run for President in 2020, but was denied. First, she never attempted to register for a Presidential run and has routinely claimed over and over that she is not ever going to run for President. This is a propaganda site.

patriothangout.com.name: Patriot Hangout
patriothangout.com.notes: The Patriot Hangout is a news and opinion blog that is about as far right as it can get. Virtually every story on this website is either propaganda or flat out fake news. For example, in just scanning the first few articles today there is a story about Obama’s “Mass Slaughter of Bald Eagles“, “Obama and Hillary facing 30 years in Prison“, “Democrats links to Justice Scalia’s Death“, etc. Bottom line, this website has zero credibility.

patriotupdate.com.name: Patriot Update
patriotupdate.com.notes: Patriot Update contains over the top right wing conspiracies and propaganda. Patriot Update mostly does not source and when they do it is to other extreme right wing sites. They also post stories that lack evidence such as this one: MUSLIM IMMIGRANT RAPES AND STRANGLES ELDERLY WOMAN AFTER CHURCH. In this article there is zero evidence the person who committed the crime is Muslim. He simply is an immigrant from Morocco. Further, the source for this story is Pam Geller, who is an Anti-immigrant activist and consistently rails against Islam.

patrioticviralnews.com.name: Patriotic Viral News
patrioticviralnews.com.notes: Patriotic Viral News is a News and opinion blog that uses video clips in their articles. This source only publishes right wing content that leans heavily on propaganda. Many of the videos come from unreliable sources such as Rush Limbaugh.

personalliberty.com.name: Personal Liberty
personalliberty.com.notes: Personal Liberty is an ultra conservative source with over the top bias.  Routinely publishes conspiracies and pseudoscience information.  This source could easily be classified in the Conspiracy-Pseudoscience category. However, it has more of a political bias and attempts to publish propaganda.

plymouthpatriotpost.com.name: Plymouth Patriot Post
plymouthpatriotpost.com.notes: The Plymouth Patriot Post is news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. Almost all news is curated from other sources. Many times news is linked to credible sources, however the headlines are often highly sensationalized and do not match the more neutral content of the article. Other times news is linked to far right or conspiracy websites. There is credible news on this website, it is just hard to locate with the clickbait sensational headlines.

pmnightlynews.com.name: PM Nightly News
pmnightlynews.com.notes: PM Nightly News is a conservative news website that promotes conspiracies and also has questionable science news.  In reviewing this site the first story pulled up was a false conspiracy regarding the Clinton Foundation.  Not trustworthy.

politicalears.com.name: Political Ears
politicalears.com.notes: Political ears is an extreme right wing site that publishes mostly fake news and/or is simply poorly sourced.  Either way the content is far right and not credible.

politicoinfo.com.name: Politico Info
politicoinfo.com.notes: Politico Info is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. It is not affiliated with the large mainstream Politico website. Politico Info uses sensational headlines that do not match the story. For example, on this story “What Hillary Clinton Did IMMEDIATELY After Comey Was Fired Will Make You SICK” does not actually say what Clinton did. It displays a bunch tweets from other people and injects biased commentary into the article. Essentially, this is a typical extreme conservative site that shuns factual reporting in favor of propaganda. We also don’t recommend visiting this website unless you want to be bombarded with pop-up ads.

prntly.com.name: Prntly
prntly.com.notes: Prntly is a politically conservative American website.  It was described by Snopes as “a disreputable outlet that has a penchant for publishing both fake news and spurious pro-Trump articles.”  This website could also be classified as satire or conspiracy.

proamericanews.com.name: Pro-America News
proamericanews.com.notes: There is irony in the name of this site as they appear to hate everything about America.  Extreme right wing bias and does not shy away from conspiracy theories, especially if it involves anyone even a degree left of center.

progresstribune.com.name: Progress Tribune
progresstribune.com.notes: Progress Tribune is an independent news aggregation website with an extreme left bias. Virtually every headline uses loaded words as does the content of articles. Some articles do not list a source. Essentially, this a left wing propaganda site.

progressivestoday.com.name: Progressives Today
progressivestoday.com.notes: Don’t let the name fool you.  Progressives Today is an extreme right wing conservative site through story selection and use of extreme loaded words.

proudcons.com.name: The Proud Conservative
proudcons.com.notes: The Proud Conservative presents news with an extreme right wing bias.  Publishes information that can be false.

proudleader.com.name: Proud Leader
proudleader.com.notes: Proud Leader is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right bias. Basically, this is a fake news site. Virtually every story is either fake, unproven or misleading. This site is not worth the effort to write much. Here is a Pants on Fire claim to show their work.

proud-patriots.com.name: Proud Patriots
proud-patriots.com.notes: Proud Patriots is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website.  It does a poor job of sourcing information (if at all) and does not shy from conspiracies. They also use very sensational headlines and loaded words throughout articles. They have been accused of promoting a fake news story according to Poynter.

qpolitical.com.name: QPolitical
qpolitical.com.notes: QPolitical is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. Uses strong loaded words, promotes propaganda and does not always source to credible information. Has a very poor fact checking record.

react365.com.name: React 365
react365.com.notes: A service that allows people to create their own fake stories with the react365.com domain name.

reagancoalition.com.name: Reagan Coalition
reagancoalition.com.notes: The Reagan Coalition is an extreme right wing news websites that is mostly factually inaccurate and is listed as a fake news source on Fake News Checker.  We are pretty sure Reagan would not want his name associated with this website.

realtimepolitics.com.name: Real Time Politics
realtimepolitics.com.notes: Real Time Politics is a news and opinion website with extreme left wing bias.  They use over-the-top sensational headlines and use of loaded words in articles. RTP is loose on facts and publishes common left wing conspiracies against conservatives.  They have a poor track record with fact checkers. This is a classic clickbait propaganda site that is not trustworthy.

redcountry.us.name: Red Country – Conservative News
redcountry.us.notes: Red Country is an extreme right wing news and opinion website. Red Country promotes anti-Muslim propaganda and publishes ridiculous news that in many cases is just fake. This source also does not source to credible information. Has a Pants on Fire rating from Politifact due to publishing a fake photo of President Obama in handcuffs.

redpeople.us.name: Red People
redpeople.us.notes: Red People is a news and opinion website with extreme right wing bias that also publishes fake news. A sample article reads like this: “Massive Muslim Terror Network just Discovered in Chicago after Cops get Clue about what they were Hiding.” This story then sources another questionable website called the Conservative Daily Post, which does not even mention a terror network. The whole story is about a Muslim business owner who was selling cigarettes illegally and then Red People giving the opinion that he is funneling money to terrorist groups without evidence. This is fake news website.

redrockdaily.com.name: Red Rock Daily News
redrockdaily.com.notes: Red Rock Daily News has an extreme right wing bias in reporting.  The website is littered with racism, Islamophobia and conspiracy.

redwhiteandright.com.name: Red, White and Right
redwhiteandright.com.notes: Red, White and Right is an extreme right biased news and opinion blog. RWR uses strong loaded language in headlines and in the body of articles. They rarely source to outside media and when they do, it usually is on our questionable list. The first article on the page today is about how Obama denies his “Whiteness”, which is ironic as they also call white privilege a myth in the same article. This article is written from the perspective of white privilege from beginning to end. This is not a credible news source.

resistancereport.com.name: Resistance Report
resistancereport.com.notes: Resistance Report is a news and opinion blog/website with an extreme left wing bias. Headlines contain loaded words and are sensational. News reporting is also filled with emotional language that favors the left. Most articles are sourced, but many are sourced to far left or questionable sources. Resistance Report also has a Pants on Fire rating from Politifact.

returnofkings.com.name: Return of Kings
returnofkings.com.notes: Return of Kings is run by Daryush Valizadeh (known by his Internet alias Roosh Vörek or Roosh V) who is an American manosphere denizen, misogynist, rape apologist, pick-up artist, and sex tourist.  We suggest you take a look at RationalWiki’s write up on Roosh V for more information.

rightjournalist.com.name: Right Journalist
rightjournalist.com.notes: Right Journalist is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. Right Journalist uses loaded words and sensational headlines. They also source to highly questionable sources such as Mr. Conservative and Rush Limbaugh who has failed numerous fact checks. A source that links to questionable sources, is therefore questionable.

rightsidenews.com.name: Right Side News
rightsidenews.com.notes: Right Side News presents content with an extreme right wing bias.  Publishes conspiracies and simply is not credible.

rightsmarts.com.name: Right Smarts
rightsmarts.com.notes: Right Smarts is a blog/website with an extreme right wing bias. They use loaded words in headlines and sometimes source to other far right or questionable sources. A typical headline looks like this: Dear Trump Haters: When Your Cause Is Being Lead By A Terrorist, Maybe It’s Time To Think Things Over, in other words it is pretty biased and loaded.

rightwingnews.com.name: Right Wing News
rightwingnews.com.notes: Right Wing News was founded by John Hawkins an extreme conservative who regularly contributes articles to the radical right. Right Wing News is often factually challenged and should not be considered a valid source.

shtfplan.com.name: SHTFplan.com
shtfplan.com.notes: SHTFplan.com is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. While many stories are factual on SHTF, some are highly questionable. For example, there are many instances on the website where SHTF subscribes to the New World Order conspiracy. In other cases, they routinely use loaded language to describe African Americans. Overall, this source amounts to a right wing propaganda site.

southjerseymechanic.com.name: South Jersey Mechanic (Trump News)
southjerseymechanic.com.notes: The South Jersey Mechanic is billed as Trump News.  The website is horribly designed and simply would not work in Chrome.  It did however load on Internet Explorer.  Regardless, this is an extreme right biased site that curates news from different sources.  Not surprisingly all news is Pro-Trump.  Many of those sources come straight from our conspiracy category. Highly untrustworthy source.

stateofthenation2012.com.name: State of the Nation 2012
stateofthenation2012.com.notes: State of the Nation 2012 is a propaganda site that focuses on right wing politics.  Although debunked long ago this source continues to report on Pizzagate. They also report on the New World Order and other political conspiracies. State of the Nation 2012 does produce legitimate news among the conspiracies and propaganda.

subjectpolitics.com.name: Subject Politics
subjectpolitics.com.notes: Subject Politics is an extreme right wing news and opinion website as evidenced by their mission statement on their About page: “It is our mission to disrupt the liberal echo-chamber of victimization, moral relativism, and political correctness that suppresses honest conversation and debate.”Subject Politics uses extreme loaded language in headlines such as this: “IT’S OVER! Trump Just Went On Twitter & EXPOSED Obama’s Sick Plan! **MAKE THIS GO VIRAL.” The words “Sick Plan” is a highly negative connotation that attempts to blame former President Obama for a judges decision, where there isn’t evidence to support it. Further, in this same article they copy and paste this quote as evidence of Obama’s “sick plan”: “JUDGE WILLIAM H. ORRICK, THE FEDERAL JUDGE IN SAN FRANSISCO (spelling error), WHO BLOCKED TRUMP’S ORDER THAT WOULD DEFUND SANCTUARY CITIES, IS AN OBAMA DONOR WHO GAVE $200,000 TO GET HIM ELECTED!” There isn’t a source for this quote, so we don’t know who said it or made that claim, in fact there isn’t any source at all for this news article other than some tweets from President Trump. Furthermore, Judge Orrick did not donate 200K to Obama. He helped raise 200K through fundraising and donated 30.8K to committees supporting Obama. Whether he donated to Obama or not is not evidence of a “sick plan” to block Trump. This is a classic clickbait tactic and promotion of propaganda. Also, according to fact checkers, Subject Politics  has made false claims here and here. Lastly, Subject Politics often references very questionable sources in their articles. For example, in the article entitled “TRUMP WAS RIGHT! Obama’s Top Adviser Just Leaked His WORST Nightmare,” Subject Politics uses Rush Limbaugh as a source to support their story. While Limbaugh’s claim may be true in this case, he is an admitted entertainer and has a poor track record with fact checking.

supremepatriot.com.name: Supreme Patriot
supremepatriot.com.notes: When you see a title like “Supreme Patriot” it must make you think this is a very pro-American website that loves our constitution and all American Citizens, right?  Wrong.  This is an extreme right biased website that only seems to love white Christians.  This source has questionable content regarding race and is low on the factual side.

surenews.com.name: Sure News
surenews.com.notes: Sure News is a news and opinion website that claims to report the most shocking stories without bias.  When analyzing their content it seems the most shocking stories involve African Americans and Muslims committing violent acts against whites. Extreme right wing bias that has questionable information regarding minorities.

syrianews.cc.name: Syria News
syrianews.cc.notes: Syria News is a news and opinion website all about Syria and the current conflict. Syria News has an extreme Pro-Syrian State bias and is highly critical of all opposition.  SN uses extreme loaded language to convey emotion against the opposition and often only presents one side of the story. We also could not find an “About” page nor any information on the authors that would give insight into their mission. We have purposely not rated this website for left or right bias because they consistently rail against both if they are opposed to the Syrian State. Another factor in placing this source in the questionable category is the use of self linking. Self linking is when you link to other pages on your own website rather than outside credible sources. Based on extreme state bias, poor sourcing, and lack of information on the website, we rate this source questionable. We are not stating the information is false, just that each article should be fact checked for accuracy. We also recognize there is a strong propaganda campaign against the Syrian State by the opposition and it can be difficult to determine where the truth lies.

teaparty.org.name: Tea Party Inc
teaparty.org.notes: Teaparty.org is a news and opinion website affiliated with the Tea Party Movement. Teaparty.org presents news with extreme right wing bias through the use of loaded words and sensational headlines. They also typically publish news from far right or questionable sources such as The Angry Patriot, which is on our questionable list, as well as Politifact’s fake news list. Based on extreme bias, poor sourcing and promotion of propaganda, we rate Teaparty.org as Questionable.

tdnewswire.com.name: TD Newswire
tdnewswire.com.notes: TD Newswire is a garbage dump of extreme right wing bias and conspiracies.  Refers to liberals as libtards right in the headlines and has questionable content regarding race.  One of the worst right wing sites in existence.

teddystick.com.name: Teddy Stick
teddystick.com.notes: Teddy Stick is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. Teddy Stick publishes unverified or false news such as the story of Trump Tower being wiretapped. As of this writing there is zero evidence that this claim is true. Interestingly, the primary writer for Teddy Stick claims to be a Libertarian Journalist, however he makes a non-libertarian false report about increased crime in Sweden due to Muslim immigration. This too has been refuted by multiple sources including the libertarian Reason.com. I see nothing here related to the libertarian platform. I see a far right conservative website that publishes questionable information. (D. Van Zandt)

tmn.today.name: Tell Me Now
tmn.today.notes: A web based right wing news and general information site.  Has overt bias in favor of conservatives and Donald Trump.  Publishes some conspiracy stories and has questionable content regarding race.

theamericanmirror.com.name: The American Mirror
theamericanmirror.com.notes: The American Mirror is an online news and opinion website with an overt right wing bias.  Not all stories are sourced to credible information.

angrypatriotmovement.com.name: The Angry Patriot
angrypatriotmovement.com.notes: The Angry Patriot is a very right wing biased website with many conspiracies and fake news stories.  A very untrustworthy source that was placed on Politifact’s fake news source list.

thebostontribune.com.name: The Boston Tribune
thebostontribune.com.notes: The Boston Tribune is a right wing biased website that is attempting to sound like a legitimate newspaper.  While some of the stories on their website are real, many are not.  Snopes has found three articles on the site that are fake news.  Do not trust this site.

constitution.com.name: The Constitution
constitution.com.notes: The Constitution is an online political news and opinion source.  The Constitution has over the top right wing bias and is not very factual.  There are questionable undertones regarding race relations with a strong nationalistic view.  Requires fact checking.

dcclothesline.com.name: The D.C. Clothesline
dcclothesline.com.notes: Extreme right wing propaganda and conspiracies. Does not source to credible information.

theduran.com.name: The Duran
theduran.com.notes: The Duran is an online news and opinion source with a strong right wing bias.  There is evidence they have posted misleading information and they have perpetuated some conspiracies. The source does produce legitimate news with a right wing bias, so we will not place them in the conspiracy category at this time.

thefederalistpapers.org.name: The Federalist Papers Project
thefederalistpapers.org.notes: The Federalist Papers Project has overt right wing bias in reporting.  It often publishes misleading news stories and conspiracies that amount to fake news. Has a horrible track record with fact checking.

fairus.org.name: The Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR)
fairus.org.notes: The Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR) is a non-profit tax exempt organization in the United States that advocates changes in U.S. immigration policy that they believe would result in significant reductions in immigration, both legal and illegal.  According to the Southern Poverty Law Center The Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR) is a group with one mission: to severely limit immigration into the United States.
