Although FAIR maintains a veneer of legitimacy that has allowed its principals to testify in Congress and lobby the federal government, this veneer hides much ugliness.  FAIR has ties to white supremacist groups. Has made false claims according to fact checkers here and here.

thefreepatriot.org.name: The Free Patriot
thefreepatriot.org.notes: A news and opinion website with extreme bias. Promotes propaganda and conspiracy with little credible sourcing.

thegatewaypundit.com.name: The Gateway Pundit
thegatewaypundit.com.notes: The Gateway Pundit is a hard-right website that is not afraid of conspiracy theories and the occasional flirtation with outright white supremacists.  Not a credible source that occasionally publishes fake news.

thehornnews.com.name: The Horn News
thehornnews.com.notes: The Horn News is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right bias in reporting. Virtually, all stories are pro-right and anti-left. The Horn uses loaded language frequently and often sources information to far right and questionable sources. Has a false claim via Politifact.

newobserveronline.com.name: The New Observer
newobserveronline.com.notes: The New Observer has extreme right wing bias.  Publishes stories that are simply not true (fake news) and has very questionable content regarding African Americans.

theproudliberal.org.name: The Proud Liberal
theproudliberal.org.notes: The Proud Liberal is a news and opinion blog with an extreme left wing bias. The Proud Liberal does attempt to source, but often it is to other left wing biased sourced. They also use extreme loaded words that attempt to influence the reader. This is a propaganda source.

therightists.com.name: The Rightists
therightists.com.notes: A mix of Satire and Fake news.

therightstuff.biz.name: The Right Stuff
therightstuff.biz.notes: The Right Stuff is a white nationalist media hub that hosts several podcasts, including The Daily Shoah. It is part of the broader alt-right movement in the United States.  The website supports white nationalism and is a supporter of the belief of racialism, believing that races have different strengths and advantages, including in intelligence and strength. Promotes fascism so the government can enforce racial purity. This is simply a hate group.

thetrumpmedia.com.name: The Trump Media
thetrumpmedia.com.notes: The Trump Media is an extreme right wing clickbait website that is littered with obnoxious and sometimes inappropriate advertising. The headlines are over the top sensationalized and the content of the articles not much better. When they choose to source, it is often to extreme right or other questionable sources. While we can’t say this source is fake news, it is very close as most stories are simply propaganda. It is probably best to visit the site to see how extreme it is, but here is an example: “Barack Obama gets Devastating News from Judicial Watch,”  In this article they source Breitbart (Extreme Right), Truth Monitor (Questionable Source-Extreme Right) and finally Judicial Watch (Right with a poor fact checking record). There is not a single credible source that ties Obama to this story.

thetruthdivision.com.name: The Truth Division
thetruthdivision.com.notes: The Truth Division is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. Most headlines are sensationalized and there is little credible sourcing to trusted sources. Several articles reviewed amounted to nothing more than propaganda.

theuspatriot.com.name: The US Patriot
theuspatriot.com.notes: The US Patriot is an extreme right biased website.  They never misses an opportunity to attack liberals and promote conservatives.  Unfortunately, there is an incredible amount of misinformation on this site and some stories outright fake.

washingtonfeed.com.name: The Washington Feed
washingtonfeed.com.notes: The Washington Feed is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. This source uses strong loaded words and does not source well to credible information. Basically this is a pretty typical propaganda source. Has republished a Pants on Fire claim.

todaydispatch.com.name: Today Dispatch
todaydispatch.com.notes: Today Dispatch is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. Most news stories contain loaded words, with sensational headlines. Further, this source does not have an about page to indicate who they are and their mission. The articles reviewed today were primarily anti-immigrant and anti-liberal. Most articles source to right wing or other questionable sources. We rate this source questionable based on extreme bias, poor sourcing and promotion of propaganda.

trueactivist.com.name: True Activist
trueactivist.com.notes: True Activist is a news and opinion website with overt left wing bias in reporting and wording.  Has a poor record with consensus science and publishes some conspiracies and always propaganda.  Has some questionable fact checks.

truetrumpers.com.name: True Trumpers
truetrumpers.com.notes: True Trumpers is an extreme right wing biased fake news blog. Every headline is sensationalized and more often than not leads to fake or misleading news. Has a Pants on Fire claim.

truthexaminer.com.name: Truth Examiner
truthexaminer.com.notes: The Truth Examiner is a far left sensationalized news and opinion website.  They offer stories with overt left wing biased loaded words, misleading headlines and often poorly sourced information. For example: https://www.truthexaminer.com/2017/05/just-white-house-sources-just-revealed-donald-trump-losing-sht-right-now-details/ This source is left wing propaganda.

truthfeed.com.name: TruthFeed
truthfeed.com.notes: First, it does not have an About page which renders it questionable from the start. Who owns it? Who writes for it? Who funds it? What is the agenda? Is this supposed to be tongue in cheek or is it real?.  Second, it is very far right biased and promotes conspiracies, which again makes one wonder without an about page if they are serious.  Truthfeed uses questionable terminology such as “thugs” to describe blacks who commit crimes. Has a very questionable fact checking record.

truthmonitor.com.name: Truth Monitor
truthmonitor.com.notes: The Truth Monitor is an extreme Alt-right website that promotes propaganda. Examples: Article: JUST IN: HUNDREDS SHOT, MORE INJURED…The fact is solid – there is indeed 403 shootings by Feb 14th in Chicago.  The link to Breitbart then links to the Chicago Tribune – (should have just linked to the source and not link to a link).   False statement from article: “When the shootings continued to increase, Trump sent in more ATF agents at the beginning of February in an effort to reduce the gun crime epidemic that has overtaken the city.” – this is false.  They link to nothing however this news article the ATF denies that any new agents were sent or even Trump asking them too.    Lastly on this article it makes a statement which is not fact or lie but pure opinion.  It’s purely a biased statement often heard form the right: “Since Chicago has some of the strictest gun control laws in the country, what’s happening there serves as proof that gun control laws will NOT lower crime.”

truthrevolt.org.name: Truth Revolt
truthrevolt.org.notes: Truth Revolt is a website with extreme right wing bias in reporting and wording.  Often refers to African Americans as thugs and has published false stories.

unclesamsmisguidedchildren.com.name: Uncle Sams Misguided Children
unclesamsmisguidedchildren.com.notes: Uncle Sam’s Misguided Children is an extreme right wing propaganda and conspiracy website. They do publish some legitimate news so they must be fact checked on a per article basis. Has a false claim by Snopes.

usanewsflash.com.name: USA Newsflash
usanewsflash.com.notes: USA Newsflash is a news and opinion website with over the top right wing conspiracies and propaganda.  Almost everything reported on this site is factually incorrect. For example this: This.

uschronicle.com.name: US Chronicle
uschronicle.com.notes: US Chronicle has overt right wing bias in reporting.  Publishes occasional conspiracy theories and often uses questionable language to describe minorities.  Has a poor reputation with facts.

usherald.com.name: US Herald
usherald.com.notes: US Herald has extreme right wing bias in reporting.  Publishes some conspiracy theories and fake news such as the thoroughly debunked story of Hillary Clinton selling uranium to Russia. Routinely uses questionable language when describing minorities.

uspostman.com.name: US Postman
uspostman.com.notes: USPostman is an extreme right wing propaganda website that is known to publish fake news. When sourcing it uses other questionable or extreme right wing sources.  The USPostman also has a disclaimer on their website that reads: “We at uspostman cannot make any warranties about the completeness, reliability and accuracy of this information.” In other words they are trying to protect themselves from false claims. We should also note that they have Pants of Fire claim also.

politicsusanews.com.name: USA News/Politics USA News
politicsusanews.com.notes: USA News is an over-the-top extreme right news and opinion website. They don’t have an about page, so one can’t be sure if this is meant to be satire. If this is not satire it must be overt fake news with the intent to mislead. For example, there is an article that reads “Snoop Dogg arrested for conspiracy.” Obviously, this is not true. This source is not credible on any level. If you like viewing a lot of ads in between the fake news then this source is for you.

usanewstoday.org.name: USANewsToday
usanewstoday.org.notes: USANewsToday is an extreme right biased news and opinion website.  It is not sourced well, if at all.  Several stories would be considered satire, but we think they are actually trying to be serious.  Has failed fact checks.

usapoliticsnow.com.name: USA Politics Now
usapoliticsnow.com.notes: This is a far right wing propaganda mill that advocates for conservative candidates.  The main purpose of the website appears to be the destruction of all liberals.  This source could easily be listed as a conspiracy website as most stories are devoid of credible evidence.  Makes Pants of Fire claims such as Vince Foster being murdered. Totally untrustworthy and must be fact checked.

usasupreme.com.name: USA Supreme
usasupreme.com.notes: USA Supreme is a news and opinion website that has an extreme right wing bias. Used loaded headlines that don’t always match the article. Has a very poor fact checking record. Considered fake news by some sources.

bloodandsoil.org.name: Vanguard America
bloodandsoil.org.notes: Vanguard America or bloodandsoil.org is a Neo-Nazi white supremacist hate group. Snippets from their manifesto:  “Our America is to be a nation exclusively for the White American peoples who out of the barren hills, empty plains, and vast mountains forged the most powerful nation to ever have existed; it is logical that America must be once again built from the ground up to recapture the glory an Aryan nation deserves.” And another: “An economy that is self-contained, and free from the influence of international corporations, led by a rootless group of international Jews, which place profit beyond the interests of our people, or any people.” Case closed!

en.radiovaticana.va.name: Vatican Radio
en.radiovaticana.va.notes: Vatican Radio (VR) is, as stated on the site:

vdare.com.name: VDARE
vdare.com.notes: VDARE is an American website that publishes socio-political commentary pieces, particularly focusing on advocating for a moratorium on immigration into the United States as well as arguments related to race and American politics. According to the Southern Poverty Law Center, VDARE is an anti-immigration hate website which regularly publishes articles by prominent white nationalists, race scientists and anti-Semites.

vidmax.com.name: Vidmax
vidmax.com.notes: Publishes video’s with an extreme right wing bias. This is a propaganda site and has been called fake by other sources. Further, we were unable to evaluate more than a few of their video stories as the website is riddled with pop-up, pop-under and intrusive advertising that froze up the browser. Beware when viewing this site.

viralliberty.com.name: Viral Liberty
viralliberty.com.notes: Viral Liberty is a news and opinion source with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. Often uses loaded words in headlines that are sensationalized. Promotes propaganda through distortion of facts and has failed some fact checks. Like most questionable/fake news sources they do not offer an about page or disclaimer.

walkwithher.com.name: Walk With Her
walkwithher.com.notes: Walk With Her is a news and opinion website/blog that has an extreme left wing bias and appears to be a Pro-Clinton website from pre-election. First, there isn’t an about page that describes who owns or what the objective of this site is. Second, virtually every headline uses loaded words that are sensationalized to induce clicking (Clickbait). Within the actual articles there is use of loaded words that are often sourced to left wing or questionable sources. Lastly, like most clickbait websites this one features popup ads that make the site difficult to navigate. In the review of articles we found that some stories are true and some are flat out misleading such as: http://walkwithher.com/trumps-latest-fec-disclosure-shows-trump-has-stock-in-company-that-made-bombs-used-in-syria, which both Snopes and this website has declared unproven/verified. Further they a have a Pants on Fire claim from Politifact.

webdaily.com.name: Web Daily
webdaily.com.notes: Over the top right wing news that is laden with conspiracy and usually not factual. Consistently publishes headlines and articles that would be offensive to minorities and Muslims. Has a questionable record with fact checkers.

winningdemocrats.com.name: Winning Democrats
winningdemocrats.com.notes: Winning Democrats is an over the top extreme left wing website.  Demonstrates severe bias in wording and story choices.  Has a very poor record of factual reporting. This source produces left wing propaganda.

worldnewspolitics.com.name: World News Politics
worldnewspolitics.com.notes: World News Politics is an extreme right wing news and opinion website that uses strong emotional language and does not often source to credible information.

24wpn.com.name: WorldPolitics News
24wpn.com.notes: WorldPolitics News is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. WPN has sensational headlines and is poorly sourced. It is listed as a Fake News Website via Politifact.

worldpoliticus.com.name: World Politicus
worldpoliticus.com.notes: World Politicus is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right bias. All content favors conservatives and is negative toward liberals. Most content is not sourced at all. On March 21, 2017 they have article up about how Loretta Lynch signed the warrant to wiretap Trump’s phone for Obama. This is published one day after the FBI and Justice Department said there isn’t evidence of a wiretap. Either World Politicus has damning evidence that they did not link to, or they are a propaganda website. You decide. (D. Van Zandt)

yesimright.com.name: Yes, I’m Right
yesimright.com.notes: Yes, I’m Right, is a blog that is trying to be a news source. This source is over the top with right wing bias and unproven propaganda. Not fake news, but mostly a Donald Trump propaganda website that distorts facts.

zootfeed.com.name: ZootFeed
zootfeed.com.notes: ZootFeed.com is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. Article headlines are extremely sensationalized and often lead to content that is not sourced to legitimate content. This is a propaganda website that publishes intentional misleading stories. Listed as a conspiracy website by FakeNewsChecker.
